Description: THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF PARKS AND RECREATION WILL SUBGRANT THE LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND (LWCF) OUTDOOR RECREATION AND LEGACY PARTNERSHIP (ORLP) AWARD TO THE SAN DIEGO UNIFIED PORT DISTRICT. THE OUTDOOR RECREATION AND LEGACY PARTNERSHIP (ORLP) PROGRAM HAS AWARDED THIS PROJECT TO DEVELOP SWEETWATER PARK, TRANSFORMING 29 ACRES OF A COASTAL, ENVIRONMENTALLY DEGRADED, AND FORMERLY INDUSTRIAL-USE LAND IN CHULA VISTA, CA INTO TWO MILES OF HIKING TRAILS, NATURE-BASED PLAY ACTIVITIES, WILDLIFE VIEWING BLINDS, PICNIC AREAS, AND NATIVE PLANT GROWING GROUNDS. CHULA VISTA IS A COMMUNITY COMPRISED OF DISADVANTAGED AND SEVERELY DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES THAT LACK ADEQUATE PUBLIC PARK AND RECREATION SPACE.

THE CITY OF BRECKSVILLE WILL REPLACE THE EXISTING PLAYGROUND WITH NEW ACCESSIBLE PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT, REPLACE THE EXISTING TRAIL WITH A NEW ASPHALT LOOP TRAIL AND INSTALL A NEW ACCESSIBLE ENTRANCE RAMP AND FENCING AT KIDS QUARTERS. ADDITIONAL IMPROVEMENTS INCLUDE INSTALLING SEATING, RESURFACING THE EXISTING PICKLEBALL BASKETBALL COURT, LANDSCAPING, AND WAYFINDING SIGNAGE IN THE PARK. THE PROJECT WILL RE-ESTABLISH A VIBRANT, COHESIVE AND FUNCTIONAL PARK WITHIN WHICH ALL BRECKSVILLE RESIDENTS, AS WELL AS THE RESIDENTS OF NEIGHBORING COMMUNITIES, HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE IN OUTDOOR RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES. KIDS QUARTERS IS THE LARGEST PLAYGROUND WITHIN A NEARLY 20 SQUARE MILE MUNICIPALITY, SERVING ALL AGES IN ALL SEASONS. THE PROPOSED RENOVATIONS WILL MAKE THE PARK MORE INCLUSIVE AND FUNCTIONAL TO BETTER MEET THE ACTIVE OUTDOOR RECREATIONAL NEEDS OF A DIVERSE PUBLIC.

THE VILLAGE OF RUSSIA WILL CONSTRUCT A NEW ALL-SEASON PAVILION AND A NEW 1,800 SQUARE FOOT SPLASHPAD IN COMMUNITY PARK.  THE PAVILION WILL INCLUDE NEW ACCESSIBLE RESTROOMS THAT SERVE THE INTERIOR OF THE PAVILION AS WELL AS OUTSIDE PARK USERS. THE EXISTING SHELTER HOUSE IN COMMUNITY PARK IS PAST ITS USEFUL LIFE WITH A NARROW ENTRANCE AND STEP UP. THE DEMOLITION OF THE OUTDATED SHELTER HOUSE AND THE INSTALLATION OF A NEW ACCESSIBLE PAVILION WILL INCREASE RECREATIONAL AND GATHERING OPPORTUNITIES IN THE PARK. THERE ARE NO EXISTING SPLASHPAD SPRAY PARK FACILITIES WITHIN THE VILLAGE OF RUSSIA, SO ADDING THIS FEATURE WILL PROVIDE A LOW-COST OUTDOOR RECREATIONAL ACTIVITY FOR A BROAD RANGE OF RESIDENTS AND VISITORS. THE OUTCOME OF THIS TWO-PRONGED PROJECT WILL BRING NEW LIFE TO AN EXISTING PARK BY CREATING A CONTEMPORARY FACILITY FOR RECREATIONAL PROGRAMMING AND BY BRINGING A DESIRED AMENITY WITHIN A WALKABLE BIKEABLE DISTANCE TO THE RUSSIA COMMUNITY.

THE VILLAGE OF COLUMBUS GROVE WILL REPLACE THE CURRENT PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT WITH A NEW ACCESSIBLE PLAY STRUCTURE FOR CHILDREN AGED 2-12 YEARS AT HALL AVENUE PARK. THE PROPOSED NEW PLAYGROUND WILL INCLUDE A 6773 SQUARE FOOT POURED RUBBER SURFACE. AS THE VILLAGE S ONLY PARK WITH PLAY STRUCTURES AND ATHLETIC FIELDS, HALL AVENUE PARK IS WELL-USED BY THE COMMUNITY, HOWEVER, THE PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT IS OUTDATED. THE PROJECT WILL IMPROVE THE EXISTING PLAY AREA WITH A STRUCTURE THAT IS CONTEMPORARY, SAFE AND ACCESSIBLE TO ALL, ENCOURAGING PARENTS AND CAREGIVERS TO VISIT THE PARK WITH THEIR CHILDREN. THE PROJECT WILL NOT ALTER THE EXISTING FOOTPRINT OF THE PLAY AREA, THEREBY SUPPORTING INCLUSIVE RECREATION WHILE PRESERVING NATURAL OPEN SPACES WITHIN THE PARK FOR CONTINUED RECREATION BY ALL AGES.

THE OHIO DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES, DIVISION OF PARKS AND WATERCRAFT PROPOSES TO IMPROVE TWO BOAT RAMPS AND PARKING LOTS AT ALUM CREEK STATE PARK. ALUM CREEK STATE PARK IS A 4,630-ACRE OHIO STATE PARK IN DELAWARE COUNTY, OHIO. THE TWO HEAVILY USED BOAT RAMPS ARE LOCATED AT CHESHIRE ROAD AND AT THE PARK CAMPGROUND. THE CURRENT BOAT RAMPS ARE CRACKED AND FALLING APART IN SOME AREAS CAUSING A SAFETY ISSUE. OVERCROWDING OF THE PARKING LOTS AND THE HEAVY WAVE ACTIVITY AT THE CHESHIRE RAMP ARE ALSO SAFETY CONCERNS. THE RAMP IMPROVEMENTS WILL IMPROVE SAFETY AND RELIEVE CONGESTION. BOATING IS A POPULAR ACTIVITY AT ALUM CREEK STATE PARK. A NEW LWCF FUNDED MARINA BUILDING HAS RECENTLY BEEN COMPLETED. IMPROVING THESE TWO HEAVILY USED BOAT RAMPS WITHIN THE PARK WILL INCREASE THE SAFETY OF THESE SITES AS WELL AS PROVIDE FOR A BETTER USER EXPERIENCE.

THE OHIO DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES, DIVISION OF NATURAL AREAS   PRESERVES WILL CONSTRUCT A REPLACEMENT 100 FT. (APPROX.) PEDESTRIAN BRIDGE ACROSS EAGLE CREEK WITHIN EAGLE CREEK STATE NATURE PRESERVE. DUE TO ITS MATURE DECIDUOUS HARDWOOD FORESTS AND DIVERSE HABITATS, THE 489-ACRE EAGLE CREEK PRESERVE IS ONE OF THE MOST POPULAR SPRING WILDFLOWER DESTINATIONS IN THE STATE. A KEY COMPONENT OF THE TRAIL SYSTEM, THE EXISTING 80 BRIDGE WAS CONSTRUCTED IN 1989 TO SPAN EAGLE CREEK, A HIGH QUALITY, PERENNIAL STREAM. OVER TIME, THE STRUCTURAL INTEGRITY OF THE BRIDGE BECAME COMPROMISED BY STREAM BANK EROSION. SAFETY CONCERNS NECESSITATED THE REMOVAL OF HALF OF THE BRIDGE IN 2017, WHICH LEFT APPROXIMATELY .25 MILES OF THE BEAVER RUN TRAIL AND .5 MILES OF THE BEECH RIDGE TRAIL INACCESSIBLE TO VISITORS. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT A NEW 100 BRIDGE WITH CHARACTERISTICS SIMILAR TO THE ORIGINAL BRIDGE AND A NUMBER OF DESIGN IMPROVEMENTS. THERE WILL BE MINOR CHANGES TO THE OVERALL DIMENSIONS, IMPROVED APPROACHES FOR ACCESSIBILITY INCLUDING RAMPS AND OR BANK LEVEL APPROACHES, AND AN UPDATED DESIGN FOR THE ABUTMENTS TO BETTER ADDRESS AND WITHSTAND POTENTIAL STREAM EROSION. THE OUTCOME OF THE PROJECT WILL ALLOW VISITORS TO FULLY ENJOY THE NEARLY 4 MILES OF NATURAL SURFACE TRAILS THROUGHOUT THE PRESERVE.

ARIZONA STATE PARKS WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO TUCSON TO MAKE IMPROVEMENTS TO AN EXISTING LWCF ENCUMBERED PARK. JOAQUIN MURRIETA PARK IS OVER 50 YEARS OLD WITH MOST AMENITIES PAST THEIR USEFUL LIFE. THIS GRANT IS SPECIFICALLY FOCUSED ON FUNDING A SPLASH PAD TO DOUBLE THE SIZE OF THE PLAY AREA.  THIS WILL PROVIDE RESIDENTS ACCESS TO THE AQUATIC FEATURE FROM APRIL 1 TO OCTOBER 31 EVERY YEAR.  THE CLOSEST POOL IS 1.5 MILES AWAY.   THE OUTCOME OF THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ACCESS TO THOSE WITH DISABILITIES AND ADJACENT UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES TO THE SPLASHPAD AS THE FEATURE WILL BE ADA COMPLIANT.  IT WILL PROVIDE A NEW RECREATION OPPORTUNITY FOR RESIDENTS AND OTHERS TO USE DURING THE HOT SUMMER DAYS TO GET RELIEF FROM THE HEAT.  THE SPLASHPAD WILL RECIRCULATE THE WATER CONSERVING THIS PRECIOUS RESOURCE.

THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF WILDLIFE AND PARKS WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF DERBY TO CONSTRUCT A NEW PLAYSPACE OUTSIDE OF THE DERBY PUBLIC LIBRARY. THE PLAYSPACE WILL INCLUDE PICNIC CABANAS WITH TABLES, INTERACTIVE MUSIC LITERACY WITH LARGE INSTRUMENTS, PERFORMANCE AREA, PLAY AREA, AND AN INTERACTIVE WATER FEATURE WITH A SPLASH PAD. THE AREA HAS BEEN DESIGNED TO STIMULATE IMAGINATION THROUGH EDUCATION AND RECREATION. THE NEW PLAYSPACE WILL BE LOCATED ADJACENT TO TANGLEWOOD ELEMENTARY AND WILL BE ACCESSIBLE TO NUMEROUS ELEMENTARY STUDENTS. THIS PLAYSPACE WILL FULFILL SOME OF DERBY S NEED FOR POCKET-PARKS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY AND WILL PROVIDE AN OUTDOOR RECREATION AREA FOR ALL THOSE WHO VISIT THE LIBRARY.

THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF WILDLIFE AND PARKS WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF ATCHISON TO DEVELOP GUERRIER HILL PARK. GUERRIER HILL PARK WAS DONATED TO THE CITY OF ATCHISON IN 1927 TO BE DEVELOPED INTO A GREEN SPACE PARK. SINCE ITS DONATION, THE PARK HAS NOT HAD THE AMENITIES TO BE A SELF-SUSTAINING PARK. THE DEVELOPMENT THROUGH THIS PROJECT INCLUDES THE INSTALLATION OF A MONUMENT-STYLE PARK SIGN, STREET SIGNAGE, NEW PAVED PARKING WITH ADA ACCESSIBLE STALLS, AND AN ADA ACCESSIBLE VIEWING PLATFORM THAT WILL OVERLOOK THE MISSOURI RIVER VALLEY. WITH THE COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT, GUERRIER HILL PARK WILL HAVE THE AMENITIES TO BECOME A SELF-SUSTAINABLE PARK AND BE UTILIZED BY THE PUBLIC FOR ITS INTENDED PURPOSE.

THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF WILDLIFE AND PARKS WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF LIBERAL TO EXPAND THE PLAYGROUND AT BLUE BONNET PARK. CURRENT PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT AT BLUE BONNET PARK ARE OVER 20 YEARS OLD AND DO NOT OFFER MUCH FOR ADA ACCESS. WITH NEW PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT OFFERING ADA FEATURES, THE PARK WILL BE ABLE TO ALLOW FOR MORE DIVERSE ACCESSIBILITY. BLUE BONNET PARK IS LOCATED NEAR BOTH LIBERAL HIGH SCHOOL AND COTTONWOOD ELEMENTARY AND PROVIDES OUTDOOR RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR NUMEROUS FAMILIES YEAR-ROUND. WITH THE EXPANSION OF THIS PLAYGROUND, THE CITY OF LIBERAL EXPECTS HIGHER VISITATION AT BLUE BONNET PARK.

THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF WILDLIFE AND PARKS WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF LIBERAL TO REMOVE OLD PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT AND REPLACE WITH NEW PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT WITHIN MAHURON PARK. THE EXISTING PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT IS 20 YEARS OLD AND HAS DRAWN SOME SAFETY CONCERNS WITH THE CITY. THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THESE SAFETY CONCERNS WITH NEW REPLACEMENT EQUIPMENT. THIS PROJECT WILL CREATE A MORE ACCESSIBLE AREA WITHIN THE PARK THROUGH ACCESSIBLE PLAY EQUIPMENT FEATURES AND A NEW ACCESSIBLE SIDEWALK. LYING ON THE NORTHEASTERN EDGE OF TOWN, MAHURON PARK SUPPORTS AN UNDESERVED AND DIVERSE COMMUNITY WITHIN LIBERAL. THE NEW EQUIPMENT AND COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT AND OTHER DEVELOPMENT IS EXPECTED TO DRAW MORE UNDESERVED FAMILIES TO THE PARK.

THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF WILDLIFE AND PARKS WILL SUBGRANT LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF PITTSBURG TO DEMOLISH AND REPLACE AN EXISTING MINIATURE GOLF COURSE AT THE FOUR OAKS GOLF COURSE. IN 2020, THE CITY OF PITTSBURG CLOSED THE MINIATURE GOLF COURSE AT FOUR OAKS. THE EXISTING GOLF COURSE DATES BACK TO THE 1990S AND HAS BECOME UNUSABLE DUE TO WATER AND FOUNDATIONAL ISSUES. THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW THE CITY OF PITTSBURG TO DEMOLISH AND REPLACE THE COURSE WITH A NEW 18-HOLE COURSE THAT FEATURES IMPROVED ACCESSIBILITY AND LIGHTING. THE MINIATURE GOLF COURSE HAS PROVIDED FAMILY-FRIENDLY OUTDOOR RECREATION IN SOUTHEAST KANSAS FOR DECADES AND THROUGH THIS PROJECT WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE THIS OPPORTUNITY FOR DECADES TO COME.

THIS PLANNING GRANT FUNDS DEVELOPMENT OF A STATEWIDE TRAILS PLAN. EVERY 5 YEARS, ARIZONA STATE PARKS AND TRAILS MUST COMPLETE A NON-MOTORIZED AND MOTORIZED TRAILS PLANS PER STATUTE. THIS PLAN ADDRESSES PRIORITY ISSUES FROM THE PERSPECTIVE OF ARIZONA RESIDENTS, TRAIL LAND MANAGERS, STAKEHOLDERS, INVESTED TRAIL USERS AND THE PUBLIC. THE PLAN WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE LAND MANAGING AGENCIES, ELECTED DECISION-MAKERS, STAKEHOLDERS AND CITIZENS WITH VALUABLE INFORMATION ABOUT NON-MOTORIZED AND MOTORIZED TRAIL ACTIVITY PARTICIPATION RATES, TRAIL MANAGEMENT PRIORITIES, ISSUES AND OPINIONS. THE ARIZONA STATEWIDE TRAILS PLAN WILL ALSO INFORM RESOURCE ALLOCATION FROM THE FEDERAL RECREATIONAL TRAILS PROGRAM (RTP) AND THE STATE OFF-HIGHWAY VEHICLE RECREATION FUND.

VIRGIN ISLANDS DEPT. OF SPORTS, PARKS, AND RECREATION IS REQUESTING LWCF ASSISTANCE FOR A SCORP PLANNING GRANT. THIS PLANNING GRANT WILL ALSO ASSIST IN THE PUBLIC OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT PROCESS AS WELL AS IDENTIFYING APPROACHES TO ADDRESSING THE USVIS PRIORITIES FOR THE NEXT FIVE YEARS.

THE MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT A LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND (LWCF) OUTDOOR RECREATION LEGACY PARTNERSHIP (ORLP) GRANT TO THE CITY OF DETROIT TO REPLACE OR RENOVATE NEARLY ALL OF HEILMANN PARK S EXISTING RECREATION AMENITIES.  THIS PROJECT WILL DEMOLISH AND REPLACE THE SKATE PARK, MULTI-USE COURTS, SPORT PLAYFIELDS, PLAYGROUND, WALKING PATH WITH FITNESS STATIONS AND A GREEN PARKING LOT. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS IN THE CITY OF DETROIT, AS WELL AS THE MANY VISITORS TO THIS AREA.

THE CITY OF FARMERS BRANCH, THROUGH TEXAS PARKS AND WILDLIFE DEPARTMENT, PROPOSES TO IMPROVE THE EXISTING ORAN GOOD PARK BY CONSTRUCTING A UNIVERSAL DESIGN ALL-ABILITIES PLAYGROUND, LED LIGHTING FOR EQUIPMENT AND FURNITURE, A PRECAST CONCRETE RESTROOM BUILDING, NATIVE LANDSCAPING, SITE FURNISHINGS, AND WAYFINDING AND LWCF PROGRAM ACKNOWLEDGMENT SIGNAGE. THIS GRANT WILL CREATE A CENTRALIZED, ONE-OF-A-KIND, SIGNATURE PARK THAT WILL HELP TO DEFINE THE COMMUNITY AND APPEAL TO A WIDER VARIETY OF RESIDENTS  THE FIRST IN THE CITY. THESE UPGRADES TO ORAN GOOD PARK WILL PROVIDE THE FIRST NIGHTTIME PARK FOR EVENING USE THAT ALLOWS MORE RESIDENTS, INCLUDING COMMUTERS, TO ENJOY RECREATION IN THE EVENING HOURS.

THE CITY OF CANISTOTA WILL CONSTRUCT A PICNIC SHELTER WARMING HOUSE IN STALTING PARK, WEST OF THE PICKLEBALL COURTS. THE EXISTING PICKLEBALL COURTS CAN BE CONVERTED INTO AN ICE RINK, SO THE PICNIC SHELTER WILL BE DESIGNED TO BE CONVERTED INTO A WARMING SHELTER IN THE WINTER. ADDITIONALLY, A SIDEWALK WILL BE CONSTRUCTED TO CONNECT THE NEW SHELTER TO THE PICKLEBALL COURTS.

THE TOWN OF SUMMERFIELD WILL DEVELOP BANDERA FARMS PARK, A 120.28-ACRE REGIONAL PARK IN A RAPIDLY GROWING AREA OFGUILFORD COUNTY THAT WILL SERVE A VARIETY OF USERS. LWCF FUNDED ELEMENTS INCLUDE A 6,414 LINEAR FOOT SEGMENT OF THEPIEDMONT GREENWAY, 13,351 LINEAR FEET OF PURPOSE-BUILT NATURAL SURFACE TRAILS FOR EQUESTRIANS AND HIKERS, A 6,000-SQUAREFOOT ADVENTURE PLAYSCAPE THAT WILL OFFER VISITORS ENGAGING PLAY STRUCTURES AND SENSORY EXPERIENCES THAT RESONATE WITH THE SURROUNDING NATURAL LANDSCAPE, A PICNIC SHELTER, AND A 2-VAULT RESTROOM. THE ADVENTURE PLAYGROUND WILL BE A TREEHOUSE STYLE PLAYGROUND INSPIRED BY NATURE TO ENGAGE CHILDREN OF ALL ABILITIES TO CHALLENGE AND DISCOVER ADVENTURE AND PLAY. IT WILL INCLUDE A ROPE BRIDGE, CLIMBING WALL, SLIDE, ROPE SWING, VINE CLIMB, AT LEAST ONE ADA ELEMENT AND MORE. RESEARCH HAS SHOWN THAT NATURAL PLAY STRUCTURES MORE THAN DOUBLE THE AMOUNT OF PLAYTIME A CHILD EXPERIENCES WHEN COMPARED TO TRADITIONAL PLAY STRUCTURES.

LAWNDALE PARK, LOCATED ON MAIN STREET IN THE HEART OF LAWNDALE, NORTH CAROLINA, WILL SERVE AS A COMMUNITY PARK, PRIMARY TRAILHEAD FOR THE STAGECOACH GREENWAY, AND A TEMPORARY SOUTHERN TERMINUS FOR A TEN-MILE LONG SECTION OF THE FIRST BROAD RIVER PADDLE TRAIL. THE PARK WILL PROVIDE RECREATIONAL AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR RESIDENTS AND CREATE A DESTINATION QUALITY TOURISM ASSET FOR THE AREA. LAWNDALE PARK PROVIDES AN EXCELLENT OPPORTUNITY TO HELP FILL AN IMPORTANT NEED FOR PARKS AND OPEN SPACE IN THE AREA AND A CONNECTION TO THE RIVER THAT CREATED THE TOWN OVER 130 YEARS AGO. IT WILL ALSO HELP REVITALIZE LAWNDALE AND THE SMALL COMMUNITIES LOCATED IN NORTHERN CLEVELAND COUNTY. THE ASPHALT ACCESS ROAD AND PARKING AREA WILL ALLOW VEHICULAR ACCESS TO RECREATIONAL AMENITIES WITHIN THE APPROXIMATELY 8.5 ACRE PARK. THE FIRST SEGMENT OF THE STAGECOACH GREENWAY IN LAWNDALE PARK WILL CONNECT THE PARKING AREA WITH THE TOWN SIDEWALK SYSTEM AND FUTURE GREENWAY ROUTE. A SIDEWALK NETWORK WITHIN THE PARK WILL PROVIDE SAFE ROUTES FOR PARK USERS. A RESTROOM WITH TWO TOILETS AND WATER WILL SERVE PARK AND GREENWAY USERS. THREE PICNIC PLATFORMS WITH PICNIC TABLES AND GRILLS ARE LOCATED ALONG THE ASPHALT GREENWAY TRAIL WITHIN THE PARK. THE PARK AND GREENWAY TRAIL ENTRANCE FROM MAIN STREET WILL BE FORMALLY DEVELOPED TO INCLUDE AN ENTRANCE SIGN AND PAVER AREA. THE GREENWAY TRAIL WILL DESCEND FROM THE ENTRANCE TO THE PICNIC PLATFORMS AND PARKING AREA.  A CONCRETE RAMP WILL PROVIDE ACCESS TO THE EXISTING RIVERFRONT BEACH WHICH WILL BE REGRADED AND REPLENISHED WITH SAND. A SEPARATE CLEARED FISHING AREA WILL PROVIDE ANGLERS WITH SAFE ACCESS TO THE RIVER WHILE MINIMIZING CONFLICT WITH OTHER PARK USERS. SIGNS, SITE FURNISHINGS SUCH AS BENCHES, AND LANDSCAPING WILL PROVIDE PARK VISITORS WITH DIRECTIONAL INFORMATION. EXOTIC SPECIES WILL BE REMOVED FROM AN EXISTING OPEN GREEN AND GRASS WILL BE PLANTED.

ARIZONA STAT PARKS WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE TOWN OF FOUNTAIN HILLS TO CONSTRUCT A NEW RESTROOM STORAGE AREA AT ONE OF ITS EXISTING PARKS.   THE PARK HAS GONE THROUGH SOME RENOVATIONS IN THE PAST FEW YEARS AND THE USE OF THE PARK HAS INCREASED DRAMATICALLY.  IT WAS ALSO EVIDENT DURING COVID HOW IMPORTANT THESE OUTDOOR RECREATION FACILITIES WERE FOR BOTH THE PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH OF THE PUBLIC. THE CURRENT PARK IS DIVIDED BY A WASH WITH A BRIDGE CONNECTING THE TWO PARCELS.  THERE IS ONLY ONE RESTROOM FOR THE PUBLIC WHICH IS NOT ADEQUATE.  THE NEW RESTROOM WILL BE ADA COMPLIANT AND GENDER NEUTRAL.  THE FOUR PEAKS PARK RESTROOM PROJECT WAS RANKED VERY HIGH BASED ON THE NEED TO ADD A RESTROOM FOR HEALTH AND SAFETY REASONS. THE NEED FOR AN OPERATIONAL RESTROOM FACILITY THAT INCLUDED SINKS AND SOAP DISPENSERS TO HAVE AVAILABLE FOR HAND WASHING AND TO PREVENT THE SPREAD OF COVID 19 AND ANY FUTURE PANDEMICS AS CONVEYED BY THE AZ STATE HEALTH DEPARTMENT.  THIS PROJECT WILL INCREASE SAFETY AT FOUR PEAKS PARK WITH THE ADDITION OF AN AED TO BE INSTALLED IN THE AREA OF THE NEW RESTROOM.  THE ADDITION OF AN ADA RESTROOM WILL SERVE THIS HIGHLY USED PARK AND WAS CONSIDERED FOR ITS HEALTH AND SAFETY BENEFITS FOR THE PUBLIC.

ARIZONA STAT PARKS WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF KINGMAN TO RENOVATE AND IMPROVE AN EXISTING TOWN PARK LOCATED ALONG HISTORIC ROUTE 66. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WAS DEVELOPED WITH INPUT FROM THE PUBLIC TO CONSTRUCT A NEW ADA COMPLIANT RESTROOM, RENOVATE TWO EXISTING RAMADAS AND PUT-UP NEW ENERGY EFFICIENT LIGHTING.  THE EXISTING RESTROOM, WHICH IS NOT ACCESSIBLE, WILL BE DEMOLISHED AND AREA RETURNED TO ITS NATURAL STATE. THIS PARK IS FREQUENTED WITH BOTH LOCAL RESIDENTS AND VISITORS TRAVELING ALONG THE HEAVILY USED ROUTE 66, TO WALK THEIR PETS AT THE EXISTING DOG PARK, PICNIC UNDER THE SHADE PROVIDED BY THE RAMADAS, AND A GREEN SPACE TO HOLD INFORMAL GAMES OR ACTIVITIES. ONCE COMPLETED, THE PARK WILL BE ACCESSIBLE, HAVE ENERGY EFFICIENT LIGHTING MAKING THE AREA SAFER AFTER HOURS AND PROVIDE AN AREA FOR THE PUBLIC TO SAFETY RECREATE.

THE CITY OF TIPTON WILL CONSTRUCT A POCKET PARK IN ITS DOWNTOWN AREA, AT THE CORNER OF HWY 38 4TH STREET. THE REINVENTION OF THIS VACANT PLOT WILL HELP ENHANCE OUR DOWNTOWN AREA, INCREASE OUTDOOR RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES, AND ACT AS A SOCIAL GATHERING SPACE FOR THE COMMUNITY AND VISITORS ALIKE. IT WILL BE EQUIPPED WITH AN ACCESSIBLE SPLASH PAD, SHELTERED SEATING, AND BATHROOM FACILITIES.

THE CITY OF DES MOINES WILL RENOVATE AND REVITALIZE THE EXISTING 13-ACRE STONE PARK. THE CITY WILL USE LWCF FUNDING TO INSTALL PICKLEBALL COURTS, REPAIR THE EXISTING BASKETBALL COURT, ADD LIGHTING, FENCING, A PERIMETER WALKWAY, AND IMPROVED DRAINAGE. THESE PROJECT ELEMENTS ARE COMPONENTS OF A LARGER MASTER PLAN GUIDING THE PARKS RENOVATION.

THIS PROJECT WILL REPLACE THE EXISTING, OBSOLETE PLAYGROUND WITH A PROFESSIONALLY DESIGNED ALL-INCLUSIVE PLAYGROUND. THE PROJECT INCLUDES A PLAY STRUCTURE AND INDIVIDUAL PLAY ELEMENTS INTENTIONALLY LAID OUT IN 3 ZONES FOR SAFE AND INCLUSIVE ACTIVITY. THE PROJECT ALSO INCLUDES SAFETY SURFACING, DRAINAGE, SIGNAGE, SIDEWALKS AND CURBING THAT MEET OR EXCEED ACCESSIBILITY STANDARDS.

ARIZONA STATE PARKS WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF SHOW LOW TO CONSTRUCT 8 NEW PICKLEBALL COURTS AT ITS CAMPUS CITY PARK.  THE PROPOSED PROJECT WAS DEVELOPED WITH INPUT FROM THE PUBLIC TO INCLUDE 4 NEW PICKLEBALL COURTS IN ADDITION TO THE CURRENT 4 COURTS.  THESE EIGHT COURTS, CONSTRUCTED IN 2019, NOW ARE ADEQUATE FOR THE INCREASED POPULATION OF SHOW LOW AND THE POPULARITY OF THE SPORT.  NOT ONLY WILL THE COURTS PROVIDE ADDITIONAL FACILITIES FOR THE PUBLIC, BUT WILL BE USED BY THE LOCAL SCHOOL AS PART OF THEIR PHYSICAL EDUCATION PROGRAM.  ADDITIONAL FUNDING WILL BE USED FOR TWO RAMADAS WITH PICNIC TABLES AND AN ADA WALKWAY.  THIS FACILITY WILL AID IN PROMOTING OUTDOOR PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AND SOCIAL CONNECTIVENESS FOR ALL AGES AND ABILITIES.  THE NEED FOR THIS ACTIVITY WAS NEVER MORE EVIDENT THAN DURING THE COVID PANDEMIC WHERE OUTDOOR RECREATIONS AREAS WITH THE ABILITY TO SOCIALLY DISTANCE WAS NEEDED FOR BOTH THE PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH OF THE COMMUNITY.   ONCE COMPLETED, THE PARK WILL BE ACCESSIBLE, INCLUDE LIGHTING MAKING THE AREA SAFER AFTER HOURS AND PROVIDE AN AREA FOR THE PUBLIC TO SAFETY RECREATE IN THE EVENT OF FUTURE PANDEMICS.

THE PLANNING GRANT WILL ALLOW THE VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF FORESTS, PARKS, AND RECREATION CREATE AN INCLUSIVE STATEWIDE COMPREHENSIVE OUTDOOR RECREATION PLAN (SCORP) AND A PLANNING PROCESS ACTION PLAN FOR THE DEPARTMENT TO FOLLOW FOR FUTURE UPDATES TO THE SCORP. THE DEPARTMENTS HIGHEST PRIORITY FOR THE SCORP IS TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A COMPREHENSIVE PUBLIC INPUT PROCESS WITH SPECIAL ATTENTION PAID TO SOLICITING FEEDBACK ON RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES AND BARRIERS FROM HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES AND POPULATIONS. INFORMATION GAINED FROM PUBLIC INPUT WILL BE USED TO CREATE ACTIONABLE PRIORITIES IN THE FINAL SCORP REPORT. THE PLANNING PROCESS ACTION PLAN WILL BE USED BY THE DEPARTMENT TO ENSURE THAT FUTURE SCORP UPDATES ARE TIMELY AND ADAPTABLE AND CONTINUE TO EQUITABLY ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF VERMONTERS.
THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO REPLACE THE CURRENT OUTDATED PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT WITH NEW AND IMPROVED SAFER ADA COMPLIANT  EQUIPMENT.

THIS LAND ACQUISITION PROJECT AT RADNOR LAKE STATE NATURAL AREA AND STATE PARK IS FOR TWO ADJACENT PARCELS (9.083 ACRES) TO THE CURRENT PARK BOUNDARIES AND IS CRUCIAL FOR THE LONG-TERM MANAGEMENT PROTECTION OF TENNESSEE S FIRST NATURAL AREA. WITHIN THE FIRST YEAR OF ACQUISITION RANGER LED HIKES, VEGETATIVE RESEARCH AND OTHER INTERPRETIVE PUBLIC OPPORTUNITIES WILL BEGIN. THIS ACQUISITION IS PART OF A FUTURE CONNECTIVITY PLAN TO THE BRENTWOOD, TN GREENWAY WHICH IS HOPED TO BE COMPLETED WITHIN 3 YEARS. THIS ACQUISITION IS A PARTNERSHIP WITH THE FRIENDS OF RADNOR LAKE WHO ARE PROVIDING MATCHING LAND ASSETS UP TO 4.61 ACRES CONTIGUOUS TO THE CURRENT NATURAL AREA BOUNDARY. LEADING TO DEVELOPMENT OF 3  MILES OF NEW TRAIL AS PART OF THE HARRIS RIDGE TRAIL AT RADNOR LAKE STATE PARK. ALL OF WHICH BEING PART OF THE 3 YEAR CONNECTIVITY PLAN AND BEING LOCATED IN NASHVILLE, TENNESSEE  PROVIDING OUTDOOR RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES TO RESIDENTS AND VISITORS IN ONE THE FASTEST GROWING CITIES IN THE NATION.

THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL CONVERT THE CURRENTLY UNUSED AND DAMAGED WADING POOL INTO A ZERO-ENTRY WADING POOL WITH SPLASH FEATURES. RESIDENTS OF THE CITY OF LAKOTA WILL BENEFIT FROM A REVITALIZED SWIMMING POOL THAT WILL OFFER OPPORTUNITIES FOR FAMILY USE AGAIN.
THE WISHEK PARK DISTRICT OUTDOOR SWIMMING POOL RENOVATION WILL INCLUDE FIXING LEAKING PIPES, REPLACING THE FILTER SYSTEM, INSTALLING A NEW PVC LINER, INSTALLING A NEW CONCRETE POOL WALLS AND FLOOR.

ARIZONA STATE PARKS WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO LAKE HAVASU CITY TO DEVELOP A 1.5-ACRE VACANT LOT IN THE CENTER OF THE CITY. THE PROJECT WILL DEVELOP A PASSIVE PARK WITH SHADE STRUCTURES, PATHS, PICNIC FACILITIES, BENCHES, RESTROOM, AND AN OPEN SPACE AREA FOR ACTIVITIES.  THE OUTCOME OF THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ACCESS TO THOSE WITH DISABILITIES TO THE PICNIC AREAS, BENCHES, AND A RESTROOM. IT WILL PROVIDE A NEW RECREATION OPPORTUNITY WITH A PASSIVE PARK DEVELOPMENT WHICH WILL BE PRESERVED IN PERPETUITY IN THE HEAVILY DEVELOPED DOWNTOWN AREA.

SPOKANE COUNTY WILL USE THIS GRANT TO EXPAND AND ENHANCE LAKE ACCESS AT BEAR LAKE REGIONAL PARK FOR NON-MOTORIZED WATER RECREATION - INCLUDING SWIMMING, FISHING, CANOEING AND KAYAKING. THE PROJECT WILL REQUIRE REMOVAL OF APPROXIMATELY 570 LINEAL FEET OF GABION BASKET RETAINING WALLS THAT WERE PLACED IN THE EARLY 1990 S AND HAVE REACHED THEIR  END OF LIFE,  SIX SETS OF CONCRETE AND METAL STAIRS, AN UNDERSIZED WOOD FISHING PIER, AND A PICNIC SHELTER. THESE FEATURES WILL BE REPLACED BY SAND AND BOULDER BEACHES ALONG DESIGNATED SWIMMING AREAS, A FLOATING SWIM DOCK, THREE LOW MAINTENANCE FISHING PIERS, A DESIGNATED LAUNCH AREA FOR PADDLERS, A NEW PICNIC SHELTER, AND INCREASED ADA PARKING WITH ASSOCIATED ADA PATHWAY CONNECTIONS. A SEPTIC DRAIN-FIELD WILL BE INSTALLED ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE LAKE AND THE EXISTING RESTROOM RE-OPENED

THE COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL UTILIZE THE LWCF GRANT TO ACQUIRE A 238.2-ACRE PROPERTY LOCATED ADJACENT SOUTH AND EAST OF SWEITZER LAKE STATE PARK NEAR DELTA, CO. MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT THE LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND (LWCF) GRANT TO CASS COUNTY TO RENOVATE THE SCHUG PAVILION WITH ACCESSIBLE RESTROOMS AND THE ENTRY GATEHOUSE, PAVE THE EXISTING ENTRANCE DRIVE AND PARKING LOT, DESIGNATE THREE BARRIER-FREE AND ONE UNIVERSALLY ACCESSIBLE PARKING SPACES AND CONSTRUCT ACCESSIBLE PATHWAYS TO CONNECT FACILITIES IN DR. MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT A LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND (LWCF) GRANT TO TO THE CITY OF GREENVILLE TO CONSTRUCT A RESTROOM BUILDING AND PICNIC FACILITIES. MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT THE LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND (LWCF) GRANT TO THE CITY OF IONIA TO DEVELOP A PAVILION WITH TABLES AND GRILLS AND A WALKWAY AROUND THE PERIMETER OF HALE PARK. MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT A LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND (LWCF) GRANT TO HAMPTON TOWNSHIP TO DEVELOP A NATURALIZED AREA, AN ACCESSIBLE PLAY STRUCTURE FOR AGES 2-5 AND 5-12 WITH POURED IN PLACE ACCESSIBLE SURFACING, OVER A MILE OF ACCESSIBLE PAVED TRAIL, A CONCRETE PATH, PAVED PARKING AND SITE FURNISHINGS IN PONDSIDE PARK. MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT A LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND (LWCF) TO INGHAM COUNTY TO INCLUDE ACCESSIBILITY IMPROVEMENTS TO A PORTION OF THE NATURE TRAILS IN LAKE LANSING PARK NORTH WITH THE EXISTING BOARDWALKS BEING REPLACED AND RECONSTRUCTION OF THE DIRT TRAIL WITH CRUSHED COMPACTED STONE SURFACE. THE TOWN OF BRUNSWICK WILL CONSTRUCT A NEW RECREATION COMPLEX, TO BE KNOW AS THE MIDCOAST ATHLETIC AND RECREATION COMPLEX (MARC), THAT WILL INCLUDE A MULTI-PURPOSE FIELD, PICKLEBALL AND BASKETBALL COURTS, A SKATE PARK, AND WALKING PATHS. THE MARC WILL BENEFIT THE PEOPLE OF BRUNSWICK BY INCREASING ADA ACCESSIBILITY, INCREASE LOCAL RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES CLOSE TO HOME, AND REPLACE POPULAR RECREATIONAL RESOURCES THAT HAVE SINCE CLOSED, ULTIMATELY DEPRIVING THE COMMUNITY OF THOSE RESOURCES.

SOUTH DAKOTA GAME, FISH AND PARKS DEPARTMENT WILL SUBGRANT A LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND (LWCF) GRANT TO THE CITY OF WOLSEY TO REPLACE EXISTING OUTDATED RAINBOW PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT AND SAFETY SURFACING IN WOLSEY PARK. THE UPDATED PLAYGROUND WILL BE A GOOD IMPROVEMENT TO THIS CITY PARK IN A SMALL TOWN, AND WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITY AND VISITORS OF ALL AGES AND ABILITIES.

SOUTH DAKOTA GAME, FISH AND PARKS DEPARTMENT WILL SUBGRANT A LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND (LWCF) TO THE CITY OF WATERTOWN TO INSTALL PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT IN LIONS PARK WITH SAFETY SURFACING AND SIDEWALK. THERE IS CURRENTLY NOT A PLAYGROUND IN THIS PARK. THERE IS A NICE SHELTER THAT CAN BE RESERVED. A PLAYGROUND WOULD INCREASE RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES IN THE PARK.  THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITY AND VISITORS OF ALL AGES AND ABILITIES.

SOUTH DAKOTA GAME, FISH AND PARKS DEPARTMENT SUBGRANT A LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND (LWCF) GRANT TO THE CITY OF SALEM TO REPLACE EXISTING OUTDATED RESTROOM AND PICNIC SHELTERS IN THE SALEM CITY PARK. THE EXISTING BLOCK RESTROOM DOES NOT MEET ACCESSIBILITY REQUIREMENTS. THE EXISTING PICNIC SHELTERS ARE SMALL STRUCTURES THAT NEED TO BE REMOVED DUE TO AGE AND CONDITION. THE RESTROOM WILL MEET ACCESSIBILITY STANDARDS. THE NEW PAVILION WILL ALLOW THE CITY TO HOST MOVIE NIGHTS IN THE PARK, CONCERTS AND SPECIAL EVENTS LIKE WEDDINGS.  THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITY AND VISITORS OF ALL AGES AND ABILITIES.

SOUTH DAKOTA GAME, FISH AND PARKS DEPARTMENT WILL SUBGRANT A LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND (LWCF) TO THE CITY OF PICKSTOWN TO INSTALL ADDITIONAL PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT IN TOM BROKAW PARK. WHEN THE CITYCONSTRUCTED THE PLAYGROUND, THEY BUILT THE AREA OF SAFETY SURFACING LARGE ENOUGH TO INSTALL ADDITIONAL EQUIPMENT ABOVE WHAT THE CITY COULD AFFORD AT THAT TIME. ENGINEERED WOOD FIBER IS AN APPROVED SAFETY SURFACING FOR PLAYGROUNDS. WHILE THIS IS A GOOD SURFACE MATERIAL, IT IS A NATURAL WOOD MATERIAL AND DETERIORATES THROUGH THE NORMAL PRODUCT LIFE. THIS NATURAL WOOD PRODUCT NEEDS TO BE SUPPLEMENTED TO CONTINUE TO SERVE THE INTENDED PURPOSE OF PROVIDING A SAFE SURFACE UNDER PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT.  COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITY AND VISITORS OF ALL AGES AND ABILITIES.

SOUTH DAKOTA GAME FISH AND PARKS DEPARTMENT WILL SUBGRANT A LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND (LWCF) GRANT TO THE CITY OF MOBRIDGE TO INSTALL THREE SHADE STRUCTURES INSIDE THE FENCE AT THE MOBRIDGE AQUATIC CENTER WITHIN LEGION MEMORIAL PARK. THERE IS CURRENTLY NO SHADE INSIDE THE FENCE AT THE SWIMMING POOL. THE CITY WANTS TO PROVIDE SHADE TO GIVE SWIMMERS AND SPECTATORS A PLACE TO GET OUT OF THE SUMMER SUN WHEN THEY ARE AT THE SWIMMING POOL. THE CITY SEES THIS TO MAKE THE SWIMMING POOL EXPERIENCE MORE ENJOYABLE.  THE COMMUNITY AND VISITORS OF ALL AGES AND ABILITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT.

THE CITY OF HURON IS PROPOSING TO REPLACE 4 EXISTING LIGHT TOWERS IN THE PLAYING FIELD AND REPLACE ALL LIGHTS WITH A NEW MUSCO LIGHTING SYSTEM IN MEMORIAL BASEBALL PARK. THE EXISTING SYSTEM INCLUDES 4 LIGHT TOWERS IN THE PLAY AREA OF THE BASEBALL FIELD WHICH IS NOT SAFE FOR PARTICIPANTS. THE CURRENT LIGHTS ARE NOT ADEQUATE TO SAFELY LIGHT THE FIELD FOR AN EVENING GAME WHICH MAKES IT DANGEROUS FOR PLAYERS AS IT IS EASY TO LOSE THE BALL.

THE CITY OF HUMBOLDT IS PROPOSING TO REPLACE THE EXISTING FENCE ON THE DIAMOND A BASEBALL FIELD, AS WELL AS INSTALL SOD AND LIGHTS AND REPLACE THE BACKSTOP ON THE DIAMOND E BASEBALL FIELD AT NEEDLES FIELD.THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE THE PUBLIC OUTDOOR RECREATION OPPORTUNITY FOR HUMBOLDT, SOUTH DAKOTA RESIDENTS.

THE CITY OF GEDDES IS PROPOSING TO UPGRADE FACILITIES AND INFRASTRUCTURE AT THE BALLFIELD COMPLEX. PROJECT WORK ALSO INCLUDES ELECTRIC WIRING UPGRADES FOR FUTURE IMPROVEMENTS TO LIGHTING, DEMOLITION, SITE PREPARATION, AND LANDSCAPING.
THE CITY OF EGAN WILL REPLACE THE FENCE AT THE CITY BALLFIELD AT WOHLRABE PARK. FOR ADDED PLAYER SAFETY A YELLOW POLY CAP WILL BE INSTALLED ON THE TOP OF THE FENCE AROUND THE PLAYING FIELD.

THE CITY OF CROOKS IS PROPOSING TO INSTALL A PLAYGROUND IN HERITAGE PARK. SIDEWALK WILL ALSO BE INSTALLED TO PROVIDE ACCESS TO THE PLAYGROUND IN THIS NEW PARK. THE PARK IS BEING DEVELOPED IN A NEW RESIDENTIAL DEVELOPMENT ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THIS SMALL COMMUNITY.

THE CITY OF BROOKINGS IS PROPOSING TO DEVELOP AN 8 COURT PICKLEBALL COMPLEX IN HILLCREST PARK. THE SITE WILL ALSOSEE INSTALLATION OF SIDEWALKS, SHELTER, WATER FOUNTAIN, BENCHES   TABLES AS WELL AS TRASH RECEPTACLES.

THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF PARKS AND RECREATION WILL SUBGRANT THE LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND AWARD TO THE CITY OF ANAHEIM TO CONSTRUCT THE NEW RIVER PARK.  THE CITY WILL DEVELOP THE 3.31-ACRE PARCEL LOCATED BETWEEN THE ANGEL STADIUM PARKING LOT AND THE SANTA ANA RIVER INTO A PLACE FOR ALL AGES AND ABILITIES TO ENJOY MULTIPLE OPPORTUNITIES FOR ACTIVE PLAY AND COMMUNE WITH NATURE WITH EDUCATIONAL AND CULTURAL EXPERIENCES.  THE PROJECT AMENITIES IDENTIFIED BY THE COMMUNITY WILL INCLUDE WALKING PATHS, BUTTERFLY GARDEN, TOT AND YOUTH PLAY AREAS, SHADE STRUCTURES, SEATING AREAS, DRINKING FOUNTAINS, FITNESS STATIONS, PICNIC TABLES, BENCHES, THE USE OF CALIFORNIA NATIVE PLANTS, 90 ADDITIONAL TREES, SMALL AMPHITHEATER, CULTURAL AND NATURAL SYSTEMS INTERPRETATION.

THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF PARKS AND RECREATION WILL SUBGRANT THE LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND AWARD TO THE NAPA COUNTY FLOOD CONTROL AND WATER CONSERVATION DISTRICT TO ACQUIRE 56.8 ACRES FOR USE AS RECREATIONAL OPEN SPACE.  IMMEDIATE RECREATION BENEFITS INCLUDE ACCESS TO THE NEW PARK LANDS AND OPEN SPACE AREAS FOR WALKING, HIKING, GENERAL RECREATION AND WILDLIFE OBSERVATION.  FUTURE PHASES OF THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE HABITAT RESTORATION, DEVELOPMENT OF A BOARDWALK SYSTEM, INTERPRETIVE SIGNS AND OTHER RECREATIONAL ELEMENTS.  THE RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES OFFERED BY THIS PROJECT WILL SERVE RESIDENTS AND VISITORS OF ALL AGES.

THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF PARKS AND RECREATION WILL SUBGRANT THE LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND AWARD TO THE CITY OF DINUBA TO CREATE THE NEW VISCAYA PARK.  THIS PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT A PLAYGROUND, PICNIC PAVILION, SPORTS COURTS, WALKING AND JOGGING PATH, DOG PARK, OUTDOOR EXERCISE EQUIPMENT AREA, PUBLIC RESTROOM, PARKING LOT, PERIMETER FENCING, PARK ENTRANCE SIGN AND LANDSCAPING THROUGHOUT THE PARK. ADDITIONALLY, PARK VISITORS OF ALL AGES AND ABILITIES WILL ENJOY A SAFE COMMUNITY AREA IN WHICH TO ENJOY AN INCREASE IN OUTDOOR RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES.

THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF PARKS AND RECREATION WILL SUBGRANT THE LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND AWARD TO THE CITY OF SAN FRANCISCO TO ACQUIRE TWO PARCELS AND CREATE THE NEW LINDEN PARK.  THE TWO PARCELS OF LAND, FOR A TOTAL OF .67 ACRES, IS LOCATED IN CLOSE PROXIMITY TO DOWNTOWN SOUTH SAN FRANCISCO AND WITHIN A RESIDENTIAL NEIGHBORHOOD.  ONE PARCEL IS CURRENTLY UNPROGRAMMED GREEN SPACE WHILE THE OTHER IS A PARKING LOT.  THE COMBINED SITE IS RELATIVELY FLAT WITH GOOD VISIBILITY FROM ADJACENT STREETS.  THE NEIGHBORHOOD IS EXTREMELY WALKABLE AND THERE IS PUBLIC TRANSIT (BUS STOP) IN CLOSE PROXIMITY.  THE ACQUISITION WILL PROVIDE A PARK WITH MUCH NEEDED OUTDOOR RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES TO THE UNDERSERVED NEIGHBORHOOD THAT LACKS SUFFICIENT PARK SPACE WITHIN THE CITY.

THE CITY OF BELLE FOURCHE IS PROPOSING TO INSTALL AN INCLUSIVE PLAYGROUND AT THE ROUNDUP COMPLEX WHERE NONE HAS PREVIOUSLY BEEN AVAILABLE FOR PARK USERS. ADDITIONALLY, THEY WILL INSTALL SIDEWALKS TO ALLOW FOR EASIER ACCESS TO THE NEW PLAYGROUND.

THE CITY OF ABERDEEN IS PROPOSING TO REPLACE EXISTING PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT IN MANOR PARK. ADDITIONALLY, BENCHES AND TRASH RECEPTACLES WILL BE INSTALLED, AND SIDEWALKS WILL BE CONSTRUCTED TO INCREASE ACCESSIBILITY OF THE PLAYGROUND TO USERS.

THE GEORGIA WILDLIFE RESOURCES DIVISION (SUB-RECIPIENT) IS SEEKING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF 6 ADDITIONAL PREMIUM RV CAMPSITES AND CONSTRUCTION OF NEW LAKESIDE AMENITIES. THIS SITE WILL HELP MEET THE GROWING VISITATION FOR EVANS CO. PUBLIC FISHING AREA. VISITATION AT THE AREA INCREASED 35  OVER A YEAR AFTER OPENING THE CAMPGROUND AND CONTINUES TO INCREASE WITH THE MOST RECENT DATA INDICATING 45  MORE VISITORS IN FY 2022 THAN IN FY 2019. THE DESIGN OF THIS PROJECT WILL INCORPORATE ELEMENTS REQUESTED THROUGH PUBLIC COMMENTS FROM PAST AND CURRENT VISITORS SUCH AS HIGH AMPERAGE ELECTRICITY CONNECTIONS, SEWER HOOKUP, AND ADDITIONAL LAKESIDE AMENITIES.

THE CITY OF DOUGLAS, GEORGIA (SUB-RECIPIENT) IS SEEKING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR THE RENOVATION OF UNITY PARK, INCLUDING IMPROVING BALLFIELDS, BASKETBALL COURTS, PLAYGROUND, PICNIC SHELTER, DEVELOPING A NEW WELLNESS PARK, AND GENERAL PARK REHABILITATION. BY RENOVATING THE CURRENT RECREATION FIELDS   FACILITIES, THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES AS WELL AS GIVE LITTLE LEAGUE TEAMS RESTORED FIELDS TO PLAY ON. THE WELLNESS PARK WILL BE A NEW CONSTRUCTION AND WILL OPEN UP RECREATION TO A WHOLE NEW USER GROUP TO THE PARK. ADULTS, SENIORS   YOUTH WILL BE ABLE TO USE THIS AREA WITH 9 PIECES OF EXERCISE EQUIPMENT AS WELL AS ADA PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT.

CHEHALEM PARK AND RECREATION DISTRICT, THROUGH THE OREGON PARKS AND RECREATION DEPARTMENT, WILL UTILIZE A LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND GRANT TO DEVELOP SANDER ESTATE PARK IN DUNDEE, OREGON. DEVELOPMENT WILL INCLUDE WALKWAYS, SPLASH PAD AND WATER FEATURE, PARKING LOT, STORMWATER TREATMENT AND OVERFLOW, LIGHTING, UTILITIES, PLAYGROUND AND PLAYGROUND SURFACING, AND LANDSCAPING AND WILL PROVIDE FREE OUTDOOR RECREATION FACILITIES TO RESIDENTS OF DUNDEE.

THE NEBRASKA GAME AND PARKS COMMISSION WILL UTILIZE A LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND GRANT TO GENERALIZED OUTDOOR RECREATION SURVEY FOR THE 2026 - 2030 STATEWIDE COMPREHENSIVE OUTDOOR RECREATION PLAN TO DETERMINE OUTDOOR RECREATION ISSUES OF STATEWIDE IMPORTANCE AND EVALUATE STATEWIDE RECREATION DEMAND AND PREFERENCES. THIS SURVEY WILL INFORM THE STATES 2026-2030 STATEWIDE COMPREHENSIVE OUTDOOR RECREATION, WHICH IMPACTS THE AVAILABILITY OF OUTDOOR RECREATION FUNDING STATE-WIDE.

THE MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF RAYTOWN TO REMOVE ALL EXISTING OBSOLETE WATER PARK EQUIPMENT AND MATERIALS.  IN ITS PLACE, THE CITY WILL DECREASE THE PRESENT PARKING AREA TO CONSTRUCT A SMALL DOG PARK THAT INCLUDES WATER STATIONS FOR DOGS AND PATRONS, BENCHES, AND CONCRETE PAD ENTRY WAYS  THE DOG PARK WILL ALSO BE DELINEATED BY A CHAIN LINK FENCE. OTHER DEVELOPMENT PORTIONS OF THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE REMOVAL OF WATER MAINS, GAS AND ELECTRICAL UTILITY LINES AND INSTALLATION OF THE SAME IN LOCATIONS WHERE NEEDED  OVERHEAD ELECTRICAL LINES WILL BE BURIED  THE WATER PARK PORTION OF THE SITE WILL BE REGRADED.BY BRINGING THIS CLOSED FACILITY BACK TO PUBLIC USE, THEY WILL BE EXPANDING THE OUTDOOR RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES IN THE KANSAS CITY METRO AREA THAT CURRENTLY HAVE VERY LIMITED ACCESS TO PUBLIC RECREATIONAL FACILITIES.

THE ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL UTILIZE THE LWCF AWARD TO IMPROVE THE SOUTH ROLLY CAMPGROUND WITHIN NANCY LAKE STATE RECREATION AREA. THIS PROJECT WILL REFURBISH APPROXIMATELY 70 CAMPSITES AND REPLACE SITE SIGNAGE. SITE REFURBISHING WILL CONSIST OF WIDENING AND GRADING, DRAINAGE WORK, AND REPLACING AMENITIES (PICNIC TABLES, FIRE RINGS, MARKER POSTS, CONCRETE BUMPERS, BARRIER ROCKS, ETC). THIS CAMPGROUND IS A POPULAR YEAR-ROUND DESTINATION FOR CANOEING, HIKING, SKIING, CAMPING, PHOTOGRAPHY, AND NATURE VIEWING. IT IS ACCESSED VIA THE GEORGE PARKS HIGHWAY, NEAR THE COMMUNITY OF WILLOW, AND WITHIN AN EASY DRIVE FROM LARGER POPULATION CENTERS IN SOUTHCENTRAL ALASKA.

21-01647 ABSTRACT SUMMARYTHE KENTUCKY DEPARTMENT FOR LOCAL GOVERNMENT, OFFICE OF FEDERAL GRANTS, WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARDTO CHRISTIAN COUNTY FISCAL COURT TO RENOVATE RUFF PARK. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DEMOLISHING THE EXISTINGCONCESSION RESTROOM FACILITY AND CONSTRUCTING A NEW FACILITY AT THE SITE, REMOVING AND REPLACINGPLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT, AND RESURFACING THE PARKING LOT. THE EXISTING CONCESSION RESTROOM FACILITY ANDPLAYGROUND HAVE EXCEEDED THEIR CURRENT USEFUL LIFE. THE OUTCOME OF THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN SAFERFACILITIES FOR PARK VISITORS. RUFF PARK CURRENTLY DOES NOT HAVE AN ADA RESTROOM. THE NEW RESTROOM FACILITYWILL BE ADA ACCESSIBLE, IMPROVING THE PARKS ACCESSIBILITY FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES.

21-01643 ABSTRACT SUMMARYTHE KENTUCKY DEPARTMENT FOR LOCAL GOVERNMENT, OFFICE OF FEDERAL GRANTS, WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARDTO THE CITY OF HODGENVILLE TO IMPROVE THE CITY PARKS BALLFIELDS AND PARKING LOTS. THEOUTCOME OF THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN A SAFER ENVIRONMENT FOR BASEBALL SOFTBALL ACTIVITIES. THE NEWPARKING LOT WILL ALSO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL ACCESS TO PARK AMENITIES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES.

21-01650 ABSTRACT SUMMARYTHE KENTUCKY DEPARTMENT FOR LOCAL GOVERNMENT, OFFICE OF FEDERAL GRANTS, WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARDTO THE CITY OF WARSAW TO UPGRADE THE CONCESSION AND RESTROOM FACILITIES AT WARSAWS SPORTS PARKCOMPLEX. THE OUTCOME OF THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN MORE VISITORS TO THE PARK AND ACCESSIBLEFACILITIES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES.

21-01649 ABSTRACT SUMMARYTHE KENTUCKY DEPARTMENT FOR LOCAL GOVERNMENT, OFFICE OF FEDERAL GRANTS, WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARDTO THE CITY OF MOUNT VERNON BENTON TO PURCHASE NEW PARK AMENITIES AND CONSTRUCT A PAVED 5 WIDEWALKING TRAIL AT LAKE LINVILLE PARK. 21-01646 ABSTRACT SUMMARYTHE KENTUCKY DEPARTMENT FOR LOCAL GOVERNMENT, OFFICE OF FEDERAL GRANTS, WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARDTO THE CITY OF ELKTON TO IMPROVE THE CITY OF ELKTON-TODD COUNTY PARK. THE OUTCOME OF THIS PROJECTWILL RESULT IN A SAFER BALLFIELD AND PLAYGROUND FOR PARK VISITORS.

21-01645 ABSTRACT SUMMARYTHE KENTUCKY DEPARTMENT FOR LOCAL GOVERNMENT, OFFICE OF FEDERAL GRANTS, WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARDTO THE CITY OF DAWSON SPRINGS TO IMPROVE THE CITY PARK. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE REPLACING THE EXISTINGPLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT, EXPANDING THE T-BALL FIELD, ADDING FENCING AND LIGHTING, RELOCATING THESCOREBOARD, AND INSTALLING SIX BLEACHER SETS. THE OUTCOME OF THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN A PORTION OF THE PARK RESTORED.THIS RESTORATION WILL ALLOW THE PARK TO REOPEN AND IMPROVE OVERALL QUALITY OF LIFE FOR RESIDENTS.

21-01642 ABSTRACT SUMMARYTHE KENTUCKY DEPARTMENT FOR LOCAL GOVERNMENT, OFFICE OF FEDERAL GRANTS, WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARDTO MCCRACKEN COUNTY FISCAL COURT TO IMPROVE MCCRACKEN COUNTY PARK. THE WASHINGTON STATE RECREATION AND CONSERVATION OFFICE WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF SPOKANE PARKS AND RECREATION TO RESTORE ITS SOUTH SUSPENSION BRIDGE IN RIVERFRONT PARK. THIS PEDESTRIAN BRIDGE PROVIDES UNPARALLELED VIEWS OF THE UPPER FALLS OF THE SPOKANE RIVER AND IS AT CRITICAL RISK OF FAILURE WITHOUT SIGNIFICANT RENOVATION. THE BRIDGE DECKING IS FAILING, RAILINGS DO NOT PROVIDE ADEQUATE FALL PROTECTION, AND SIGNIFICANT PORTIONS OF THE STEEL FRAMING ARE HEAVILY CORRODED AND FAILING. THIS PROJECT WILL RESTORE THIS POPULAR ATTRACTION AND EXTEND THE BRIDGE-S USEFUL LIFE BY REPLACING THE BRIDGE DECK, RAILS, CORRODED STEEL, LIGHTING AND BRIDGE ENDS. THE PRIMARY OUTDOOR RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITY PROVIDED BY THIS PROJECT IS PEDESTRIAN ACCESS DIRECTLY ATOP ACROSS THE SPOKANE RIVER UPPER FALLS. THE BRIDGE WILL BE RENOVATED TO SERVE ALL MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC, PROVIDING SAFE ACCESS ACROSS THE RIVER SO PEOPLE OF ALL ABILITIES CAN VIEW THE WATER BELOW. THIS PROJECT BENEFITS THE PASTORAL USERS OF SPOKANE PARKS REGARDLESS OF AGE, INCOME, OR PHYSICAL ABILITY. THIS PROJECT ENSURES ANYONE INTERESTED CAN WALK, STAND, OR WHEEL TO DIRECTLY ABOVE THE SPOKANE FALLS TO FEEL THE SPRAY OF THE RIVER, APPRECIATE OUR NATURAL ENVIRONMENT, AND CONNECT WITH THE SPOKANE RIVER.

FAYETTE COUNTY PARK POOL REPAIRS (BECKWITH WV, FAYETTE CO.). REPLACE OBSOLESCED SWIMMING POOL PUMP,FILTER AND INTERNAL DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM INSIDE THE POOL BATHHOUSE.

J. P. COLEMAN STATE PARK IS AN EXISTING LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND ASSISTED PARK AND HAS SERVED AS A PRIMARY OUTDOOR RECREATION DESTINATION IN MISSISSIPPI FOR GENERATIONS. THE PARK PROVIDES BOATING AND FISHING OPPORTUNITIES IN PICKWICK LAKE ALONG WITH DAY USE AND CAMPING FACILITIES. DURING THE FISHING SEASON PARK FACILITIES RECEIVE HEAVY USE.BECAUSE OF AGE, WEATHER, AND USE BY THE PUBLIC, THE PARKS FACILITIES NEED RENOVATION. THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF WILDLIFE, FISHERIES, AND PARKS WILL RENOVATE A VARIETY OF THE PARK S BUILDINGS INCLUDING THE PARK ENTRANCE GATEHOUSE, CABINS AND COTTAGES, CAMPER PAVILION, LARGE PAVILION, CAMPGROUND RESTROOM, CAMPGROUND BATHHOUSE, LINEN STORAGE BUILDING, MARINA ENTRANCE, SWIMMING POOL AND POOL HOUSE, PICNIC TABLE SHELTERS, AND NEW PLAYGROUND.J. P. COLEMAN STATE PARK, BORDERED BY TENNESSEE AND ALABAMA, IS IN TISHOMINGO COUNTY, POPULATION 18,750. 21  OF THE COUNTY POPULATION IS AGE 65 AND OLDER, WHILE 21.6  IS UNDER 18 YEARS OLD. THE NEARBY CITY OF IUKA HAS A POPULATION OF APPROXIMATELY 3,000. THIS PARK IS A POPULAR DESTINATION FOR LOCAL, STATE-WIDE, AND OUT OF STATE VISITORS. THESE PROPOSED IMPROVEMENTS WILL PROVIDE AN INCREASED LEVEL OF OPPORTUNITIES FOR A VARIETY OF USERS OF ALL AGES.

MISSOURI STATE PARKS WILL MAKE PLAYGROUND IMPROVEMENTS AT TWO LOCATIONS WITHIN MERAMEC STATE PARK. THE PLAYGROUND IMPROVEMENTS WILL TAKE PLACE AT AND AROUND 2 EXISTING LOCATIONS, ONE NEAR THE DAY USE AREA, AND THE OTHER NEAR THE CAMPGROUND. IMPROVEMENTS TO THE DAY USE AREA WILL INCLUDE DEDICATED PLAYGROUND PARKING, ACCESSIBLE SIDEWALKS FROM PARKING TO THE PLAYGROUND AND BASKETBALL COURT, INSTALLATION OF A DRINKING FOUNTAIN TO SERVE THE PLAYGROUND AND BASKETBALL COURT, RESURFACING THE BASKETBALL COURT AND NEW PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT.IMPROVEMENTS TO THE CAMPGROUND PLAYGROUND INCLUDE RELOCATION OF THE PLAYGROUND SLIGHTLY TO THE SOUTH, CONSTRUCTION OF PLAYGROUND PARKING AND ACCESSIBLE SIDEWALKS TO PLAYGROUND, AND INSTALLATION OF NEW PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT AND PLAYGROUND SURFACING.AS A RESULT OF THIS PROJECT, IMPROVED RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES WILL BE BROUGHT TO THE PARK. THIS WILL BENEFIT SAFE ACCESS TO PLAYGROUNDS FOR SITE GUESTS. THIS WILL ALLOW ADDITIONAL LONG TERM RECREATIONAL BENEFITS TO ALL THE VISITORS TO MERAMEC STATE PARKS.

THE COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES, WILL UTILIZE LWCF FUNDING TO DEVELOP GOLDEN GATE CANYON STATE PARK WITH EVAPOTRANSPIRATION FIELDS, FORCED SEWER PIPELINE AND RENOVATION OF AN EXISTING SEWER LIFT STATION. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE AN UPDATED, SAFE, AND SANITARY WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT FOR PARK VISITORS, AND WILL PROTECT NATURAL RESOURCES BY REMOVING THE POSSIBILITY OF GROUND CONTAMINATION.

THE COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE TOWN OF SPRINGFIELD TO RENOVATE THE 2.17-ACRCE SPRINGFIELD MUNICIPAL POOL. RENOVATION WILL CONSIST OF INSTALLING A NEW POOL LINER, SLIDE, AND UPDATE THE BATHHOUSE TO MEET ACCESSIBILITY STANDARDS. THIS BATHHOUSE RENOVATION INCLUDES AN EXPANSION OF THE EXISTING SHOWER FACILITIES TO BETTER ACCOMMODATE PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES, NEW ROOF, UPDATED PLUMBING, ACCESSIBLE TOILETS AND SHOWERS.THE TOWN OF SPRINGFIELD HAS A POPULATION OF ROUGHLY 1,380 PEOPLE WHO ARE VASTLY UNDERSERVED WHEN IT COMES TO OUTDOOR RECREATION ACTIVITIES. THIS IS THE ONLY SWIMMING POOL IN 20 MILES. THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROMOTE COMMUNITY HEALTH AND RECREATION FOR THE RURAL, ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED SPRINGFIELD COMMUNITY, WHERE 58  OF FAMILIES QUALIFY FOR FREE OR REDUCED MEAL BENEFITS, AN INDICATOR OF POVERTY.

THE COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF GREELEY TO ACQUIRE THE SHUR VIEW PROPERTY, A 978-ACRE PROPERTY. ACQUISITION OF THIS PROPERTY WILL ALLOW DEVELOPMENT OF 17 MILES OF TRAILS, INCLUDING SINGLE-TRACK AND BIKE DOWNHILL TRAILS NOT CURRENTLY AVAILABLE OR LIMITED IN THE REGION, MEETING COMMUNITY DEMAND FOR DIVERSE OUTDOOR RECREATION OPTIONS, AS WELL AS PRESERVE SIGNIFICANT WILDLIFE HABITAT AND A COMMUNITY BUFFER BETWEEN THE RAPIDLY GROWING COMMUNITIES.

THE NEBRASKA GAME AND PARKS COMMISSION WILL UTILIZE A LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND GRANT TO REMOVE FORT ROBINSON STATE PARKS EXISTING, AGING SWIMMING POOL FACILITY, WHICH WAS CONSTRUCTED IN 1979, AND REPLACE IT ON THE SAME FOOTPRINT WITH A MODERN FACILITY TO INCLUDE A ZERO ENTRY POOL WITH SLIDE AND SPLASH PAD. THIS FACILITY WILL BE CONSTRUCTED USING MODERN PIPING, PUMPING, FIXTURES, AND CHEMICAL TECHNOLOGY. IT WILL BENEFIT FORT ROBINSON VISITORS OF ALL ABILITIES.

THE COUNTY OF KAUAI, THROUGH HAWAII DEPARTMENT OF LAND AND NATURAL RESOURCES, WILL UTILIZE LWCF FUNDING TO REPLACE EXISTING TICKET BOOTH AND FENCING BY CONSTRUCTING A NEW COMBINED USE BUILDING WITH COMFORT STATION, TICKET BOOTH, FOOD PREPARATION AREA, AND FOOD CONCESSION ALONG WITH CONCRETE WALKWAYS AND FENCING AT THE HANAPEPE STADIUM COMPLEX. THE TOWN OF ERIE THROUGH THE COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES DIVISION OF PARKS AND WILDLIFE (CPW) WILL UTILIZE LWCF FUNDING TO CONSTRUCT AN EVENT PROMENADE, A MULTI-USE LAWN, ADDITIONAL PARKING, TWO LARGE SHADE STRUCTURES, A RESTROOM BUILDING, ADDITIONAL PARKING, EXPANDED TRAIL CONNECTIONS THROUGHOUT THE PARK, A NATURE THEMED PLAYGROUND, TREE PLANTING AND LANDSCAPING TO THE 6.1-ACRE COAL CREEK PARK. THIS PARK SERVES THE OLD TOWN OF ERIE, WHERE THE MAJORITY OF RESIDENTS LIVE WITHIN A 10-MINUTE WALK. OTHER GREEN SPACES IN THE AREA ARE CUT OFF BY COAL CREEK AND HIGHWAYS.

THE CITY OF GLENWOOD SPRINGS THROUGH THE COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL UTILIZE THE LWCF AWARD TO CONSTRUCT THE CITYS FIRST UNIVERSAL DESIGN PLAYGROUND AND ENHANCE SITE FEATURES AT THE 9.96-ACRE SAYRE PARK. THIS PROJECT INCLUDES THE REMOVAL OF THE EXISTING 20+ YEAR OLD PLAYGROUND, CONSTRUCTION OF A UNIVERSAL DESIGN PLAYGROUND, ADA WALKWAYS, REMOVAL AND REPLACEMENT OF THE 20+ YEAR OLD RESTROOM WITH A NEW RESTROOM FACILITY, LANDSCAPING, NEW FURNISHINGS, IRRIGATION EFFICIENCY UPGRADES, A PAVILION IN THE NORTHEAST QUADRANT OF THE PARK, WATER AND SEWER SERVICE, SIGNAGE, BEAR PROOF TRASH CANS, DRINKING FOUNTAINS, BENCHES, NEW BBQ GRILLS.THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE PLAY AND RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES FOR CHILDREN OF ALL AGES AND ABILITIES WITHIN THE CITY OF GLENWOOD.

THE WASHINGTON RECREATION AND CONSERVATION OFFICE WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF SEATTLE PARKS AND RECREATION DEPARTMENT TO RENOVATE MAPLE WOOD PLAYFIELD, A 9.4-ACRE PROJECT SITE IN THE BEACON HILL NEIGHBORHOOD OF SOUTHEAST SEATTLE. THIS PROJECT WILL IMPLEMENT FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS FOR THE PLAYFIELD, PLAY AREA, RESTROOM, AND PROVIDE ACCESSIBILITY THROUGHOUT THE PARK. THE IMPROVEMENTS WILL INCLUDE NEW DRAINAGE AND IRRIGATION, REGRADING OF THE FIELDS, NEW GRASS PLAYING SURFACE, NEW BACKSTOPS, DUGOUTS, BLEACHERS, AND ADJUSTMENTS TO THE FIELDS TO ALLOW FOR A WIDER VARIETY OF SPORTS TO BE PLAYED. THE RENOVATION WILL ALSO INCLUDE NEW PLAY EQUIPMENT AND RECONFIGURATION OF THE PLAY AREA LAYOUT TO OPTIMIZE PLAY VALUE, ACCESSIBILITY, AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR ENHANCED SAFETY AND PARENTAL SUPERVISION. THE PRIMARY RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITY IS FIELD SPORTS AND ACTIVE PLAY.

ARIZONA STATE PARKS WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE TOWN OF QUARTZSITE TO RENOVATE AND IMPROVE AN EXISTING 80- ACRE TOWN PARK LOCATED ACROSS THE STREET FROM THE TOWN HALL. THE OUTCOME OF THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ACCESS TO THOSE WITH DISABILITIES TO THE PICNIC AREAS, RESTROOM, PLAYGROUND AND SPLASHPAD.  IT WILL PROVIDE A NEW RECREATION OPPORTUNITY WITH A NEW SPLASHPAD AS THERE CURRENTLY ARE NO POOLS OR SPLASHPADS WITHIN 20 MILES OF THE TOWN, PROVIDE SAFE ACCESS TO FACILITIES AT NIGHT WITH THE NEW LIGHTING, AND ENCOURAGE MORE YEAR-ROUND RECREATIONAL USE AT THE PARK.

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT THE LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND AWARD TO WHITE LAKE TOWNSHIP. THE MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE ST. LOUIS COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF PARKS AND RECREATION TO RENOVATE KINLOCH PARK. THE RENOVATION WILL INCLUDE THE DEMOLITION AND REMOVAL OF EXISTING STRUCTURES INCLUDING THE RESTROOM, PICNIC SHELTER, BASKETBALL COURTS, SOFTBALL BACKSTOP, DRINKING FOUNTAIN, GRILL, BENCHES, PAVING AND FENCING. NEW CONSTRUCTION WILL INCLUDE REPLACEMENT OF THE OLD BATHROOM WITH A PREFABRICATED STRUCTURE, THE BASKETBALL COURTS WILL BE REPLACED WITH TWO NEW COURTS RE-ORIENTED IN THE NORTH-SOUTH DIRECTION AND FENCING, THE PARKING LOT WILL BE REPLACED WITH A NEW ON-SITE PARKING LOT, A NEW PLAYGROUND WITH A VARIETY OF FEATURES AND RUBBERIZED SAFETY SURFACING, AND A NEW FOOTBALL SOCCER FIELD WILL BE INSTALLED WHERE THE SOFTBALL FIELD WAS LOCATED. OTHER ELEMENTS OF THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE CONSTRUCTION OF BENCHES, SHADE STRUCTURES, DRINKING FOUNTAINS, TRASH RECEPTACLES, A GRILL AND SIGNAGE LOCATED AT THE ENTRANCE TO THE PARKING LOT. THE COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCE WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF COLORADO SPRINGS TO ACQUIRE 84 6 ACRES FOR FISHERS CANYON LWCF ASSISTANCE WILL BE USED TO ACQUIRE 84 6 ACRES OF THE FISHERS CANYON PROPERTY  THE FISHERSCANYON PROPERTY IS 342 98 ACRES, BUT THE CITY OF COLORADO SPRINGS ACQUIRED 258 4 ACRES IN NOVEMBER 2021  THE ENTIRE PROPERTY WILL BE ENCUMBERED AS PART OF THE LWCF BOUNDARY  THE PROPERTY IS CURRENTLY OWNED BY CHEYENNE MOUNTAIN BLUFFS, LLC  THE CITY IS WORKING IN PARTNERSHIP ON FISHERS CANYON PROPERTY WITH THE CONSERVATION FUND, A NATIONWIDE ENVIRONMENTAL NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION, TO ASSIST IN THE REAL ESTATE PROCESS AS WELL AS BRIDGE FINANCING A WAIVER OF RETROACTIVITY HAS BEEN APPROVED ON 2 23 22 PURCHASE OF THE FISHERS CANYON OPEN SPACE PROPERTY WILL SUPPORT THE CITY OF COLORADO SPRINGS  EFFORT TO PROVIDE UNIQUE OPPORTUNITIES FOR RECREATION AND EQUITABLE ACCESS TO PARKS, TRAILS, AND OPEN SPACES  UNIQUELY, THE PROPERTY EQUALLY SUPPORTS THE NEEDS OF CONSERVATION AND RECREATION, ADDING TO THE NATURAL RESOURCE VALUES OF A CONNECTED OPEN SPACE SYSTEM, WHILE ALSO BOLSTERING OUR RECREATION ECONOMY FUTURE TRAIL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SITE, PENDING A PUBLIC PROCESS, COULD CREATE A NETWORK OF SHORTER DISTANCE LOOPS IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS OF THE PROPERTY, SUITABLE FOR LESS STRENUOUS HIKES, AND THEN MORE REGIONAL CONNECTIONS THROUGH THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS TO THE STATE PARK AND NATIONAL FOREST THAT WOULD ALLOW FOR LONG DISTANCE USE  THE UNIQUE FEATURES OF THE PROPERTY, TO INCLUDE HIGH ELEVATION, ROCKY TERRAIN, AS WELL AS LOWER ELEVATION PONDEROSA PINE FORESTS, FLUSH WITH PRAIRIE GRASSES, WILL PROVIDE A RANGE OF RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES FOR A VARIETY OF USERS  THIS ACQUISITION WOULD ALLOW FOR CONNECTIONS BETWEEN THE ADJACENT CHEYENNE MOUNTAIN STATE PARK AND PIKES NATIONAL FOREST PROPERTIES, FORMING A LARGER CONGLOMERATE OF NATURAL AREAS AND PROTECTED PUBLIC LANDS RESIDENTS OF COLORADO SPRINGS WILL BENEFIT FROM INCREASED OPEN SPACE AND RECREATIONAL AREAS

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT THE LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND AWARD TO INGHAM COUNTY  THE PROJECT WILL REMOVE THE EXISTING BOARDWALK AND STAIRWAY AND REPLACE THEM WITH A NEW ACCESSIBLE FLOATING BOARDWALK, FISHING DOCKS AND ACCESSIBLE PATH APPROACHES  A MINIMUM OF 26  OF THE DOCK AND BOARDWALK RAILINGS WILL BE AT 32 INCHES IN HEIGHT TO PROVIDE ACCESSIBLE FISHING AND VIEWING OPPORTUNITIES  THE EXISTING PATH WILL BE REPLACED WITH A WIDER PATH ALONG THE WATER TO EXTEND TO THE DOCKS  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO INCLUDE NATIVE PLANTING RESTORATION, RECYCLE BINS AND INTERPRETIVE SIGNAGE WITHIN HAWK ISLAND PARK  COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT WILL FOSTER STEWARDSHIP AND CONSERVATION THROUGH THE ADDITION OF INFORMATIVE AND INTERPRETIVE SIGNAGE, IMPROVE RECREATIONAL ACCESS TO VISITORS OF ALL BACKGROUNDS AND ABILITIES, PROVIDE QUALITY EXPERIENCES WITH THE NATURAL RESOURCES ASSOCIATED WITH HAWK ISLAND POND AND WILL ENHANCE HEALTH AND PROPERITY OF THE SURROUNDING REGION  THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE ENTIRE COUNTY, AS WELL AS THE OVER 500,000 VISITORS WHO FREQUENT THIS PARK  IT WILL ALSO PROVIDE AN OUTDOOR RECREATION EXPERIENCE THAT IS NOT OTHERWISE AVAILABLE WITHIN 12 MILES

SEATTLE PARKS AND RECREATION WILL USE THIS FUNDING TO DEVELOP THE NORTH RAINIER LAND BANKED (NRLB) SITE, A NEW 1-ACRE PARK IN THE RAINIER VALLEY OF SOUTHEAST SEATTLE. FUNDED ELEMENTS INCLUDE A FITNESS ZONE WITH EXERCISE EQUIPMENT, PICNIC TABLES, PLAYGROUND, CIRCULATION PATHS, AND GREEN SPACE. THE PRIMARY RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES PROVIDED BY THIS GRANT ARE PICNICKING, FITNESS AND ACTIVE PLAY.

THIS GRANT PROJECT WILL      SUPPORT THE STATE OF NEVADA IN ITS STUDY OF A COMPREHENSIVE STATEWIDE      HISTORIC CONTEXT TO EVALUATE THE HISTORY OF OUTDOOR RECREATION IN NEVADA  THE NEVADA STATEWIDE      OUTDOOR RECREATION HISTORIC CONTEXT WILL ASSESS THE IMPACT OF LWCF      PROJECTS ON THE RESOURCES   THIS CONTEXT WILL SUBSEQUENTLY BE USED TO GUIDE MANAGEMENT DECISIONS TO FACILITATE APPROPRIATE STRATEGIES FOR DEALING WITH THESE OUTDOOR RECREATION RESOURCES  ONCE DEVELOPED, THIS CONTEXT WOULD BE AVAILABLE FOR USE TO ALL AGENCIES DEVELOPING OUTDOOR RECREATION PROJECTS IN NEVADA 1  DEVELOPMENT OF A STATEWIDE OUTDOOR RECREATION HISTORIC CONTEXT TO ENHANCE AND REFINE THE PREVIOUSLY DEVELOPED ASSET INVENTORY THAT WAS COMPLETED AS PART OF THE 2022 2026 SCORP 2  CONSULTANT TO RESEARCH AND DEVELOP THE BACKGROUND HISTORY, RELEVANT CONTEXT, TIME FRAMES, GEOGRAPHIC AREAS, APPROPRIATE THEMES, RELEVANT PROPERTY TYPES, PHYSICAL CHARACTERISTICS AND INTEGRITY PARAMETERS TO ADDRESS POTENTIAL LOCAL, STATE AND NATIONAL SIGNIFICANCE RELATED TO OUTDOOR RECREATION AND THE VARYING QUALITIES AND CHARACTERISTICS FEATURED IN THE STATE OF NEVADA  THIS WILL LIKELY INCLUDE YET TO BE DETERMINED PERSONNEL, PROJECT MANAGEMENT, FACILITATION, TRAVEL, EQUIPMENT,  POTENTIAL INTERVIEWS, ANALYSIS AND REPORT DEVELOPMENT, DRAFT AND FINAL DOCUMENT PREPARATION 3  DEVELOPMENT OF A SUMMARY REPORT OF ALL THE FINDINGS FROM THE RESEARCH CONDUCTED STATEWIDE BY THE TO BE DETERMINED CONSULTANT 4  COMPLETED STATEWIDE OUTDOOR RECREATION HISTORIC CONTEXT DEVELOPED IN CONJUNCTION WITH AND APPROVED BY NEVADA DIVISION OF STATE PARKS  NDSP  STAFF IN A FULLY DESIGNED DOCUMENT INCLUDING GRAPHICS, IMAGES, ETC

THE SHILOH CITY COUNCIL WITH INPUT FROM COMMUNITY MEMBERS IDENTIFIED A NEED TO RESTORE THE PARK'S DETERIORATED AMENITIES AND INSTALL NEW ONES, ADDING A PLAYGROUND TO MEET THE NEEDS OF A POPULATION WITH CHILDREN WHO SHOULD HAVE ACCESS TO PUBLIC RECREATION.THE LWCF RENOVATIONS WILL INCLUDE:- PAVING INSTALLATION- NEW BENCHES- NEW TRASH RECEPTACLES- LARGE PUBLIC MESSAGE BOARD- PET WASTE DISPOSAL RECEPTACLES- BICYCLE RACK- PLAYGROUND- INSTALLATION OF AMENITIES

ROCKDALE COUNTY IS REQUESTING LWCF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE THROUGH ITS STATE PARTNER, THE GEORGIA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (DNR). THE COUNTY INTENDS TO DEVELOP THE DECASTRO TRAILHEAD PROPERTY AS PART OF THE ROCKDALE RIVER TRAIL SYSTEM. THE DEVELOPMENT WILL BE A RENOVATION OF AN EXISTING STRUCTURE THAT WAS GIFTED TO THE COUNTY IN 1996.PLANS ARE TO RENOVATE INTO A NATURE CENTER AND PAVILION. OUTDOOR RENOVATIONS INCLUDE SIDEWALKS, LANDSCAPING, PICNIC TABLES, TRASH CANS, AND GRILLS. THE INTERIOR RENOVATIONS WILL INCLUDE STRUCTURAL REINFORCEMENT AND MAKING THE RESTROOMS ACCESSIBLE WITHIN THE NATURE CENTER.

THE CITY OF RINGGOLD IS REQUESTING LWCF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE THROUGH ITS STATE PARTNER, THE GEORGIA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (DNR). THE CITY INTENDS TO CONTINUE ON TO STAGE 2 OF THE GOLDEN MILE TRAIL, WHICH IS PART OF THE CHICKAMAUGA CREEK GREENWAY SYSTEM.GENERAL SITE IMPROVEMENTS INCLUDE IMPROVING AN EXISTING 3,000-FOOT TRAIL WITH CONCRETE/HARD SURFACE MATERIAL, CREATE ACCESSIBLE PARKING SPACES, INSTALLING THREE TRASH RECEPTACLES, THREE PARK BENCHES, TWO PICNIC TABLES, AND TWO HISTORICAL/EDUCATIONAL SIGNS. ACCESS REQUIREMENTS UNDER THE ADA AND ABA ACT ARE BEING ADDRESSED BY CREATING TWO ACCESSIBLE PARKING SPACES, INSTALLING PARK BENCHES TO GIVE THOSE WHO ARE UNABLE TO WALK LONG DISTANCES AT A TIME PLACES TO STOP AND REST, AND IMPROVING A WALKING TRAIL WITH CONCRETE/HARD SURFACE TO MEET ADA STANDARDS.

THE NORTH CAROLINA, DIVISION OF PARKS AND RECREATION IS THE RECIPIENT OF THE LWCF AWARD FOR NATCHEZ STATE PARK RENOVATIONS. THE PROJECT WILL RENOVATE, REPAIR, AND IMPROVE THE PARK'S 10 CABINS AND WILL LANDSCAPE AND PROVIDE EROSION CONTROL MEASURES ON-SITE. UPGRADES HAVE NOT BEEN COMPLETED IN APPROXIMATELY 40 YEARS AT THE PARK AND MUCH NEEDED WORKS IS REQUIRED TO REPAIR OR REPLACE ROTTEN EXTERIOR AND INTERIOR SIDING, FLOORS, CEILING, ROOF, SOFFIT, FASCIA ETC.. REPLACEMENT OF CARPET WITH DURABLE VINYL PLANK TILE FLOORING AND REPLACEMNT OF BATHROOM SHOWERS, LAVATORY AND CABINETRY. ALSO TO BE INSTALLED OUTSIDE OF THE CABINS ARE OUTDOOR GRILLS AND FIRE PITS.THE PARK REHABILITATION WILL IMPROVE THE PUBLIC'S EXPERIENCE WITHIN THE PARK BY RE-ESTABLISHING STRUCTURAL INTEGRITY AND FUNCTION. BECAUSE THIS IS A STATE PARK, THIS WILL NOT ONLY PROVIDE A BETTER OUTDOOR EXPERIENCE FOR THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AND STATE BUT ANYONE WHO VISITS THE PARK FROM OUT OF STATE. THE REHABILITATION WILL ALSO INCREASE THE LIFE OF THE STRUCTURES THAT WILL BE REHABILITATED.

THE REHABILITATION WILL ALSO INCREASE THE LIFETIME OF THE STRUCTURES THAT WILL BE REHABILITATED

THE DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL (DNREC), DIVISION OF PARKS & RECREATION WILL RECONSTRUCT A SEVEN-ACRE PARKING LOT THAT SERVES THE MAIN BATHHOUSE AND BEACH ACCESS AT CAPE HENLOPEN STATE PARK. THESE UPGRADES ARE BEING MADE BECAUSE THE AREA HAS POTHOLES, CRACKING, UPHEAVING, AND RUTTING. THESE AREAS HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED FOR FULL DEPTH PATCHING WHICH IS ANTICIPATED TO BE A DISTURBANCE OF LESS THAN 1.0 ACRE. ALSO, THE DRAINAGE WILL BE IMPROVED WITH APPROPRIATE GRADING AND INSTALLING INFILTRATION BASINS IN THE EXISTING MEDIAN AREAS OF THE PARKING LOT. NO EXPANSION OF THE PARKING LOT IS ANTICIPATED. THE REMAINING PARKING AREA WILL BE MILL AND OVERLAY.THIS PROJECT IS A REPAVING OF CAPE HENLOPEN'S MAIN BEACH PARKING LOT. THE EXTENT OF THE PROJECT IS ASPHALT OVERLAY OF THE EXISTING PARKING LOT AND TWO ENTRANCES INTO THE LOT. REPAVING IS CONSISTENT WITH ACCESS REQUIREMENTS UNDER THE ADA AND ABA. THE BATHHOUSE AND BEACH ACCESS IS CURRENTLY ACCESSIBLE AND WILL NOT BE IMPACTED BY THE PARK PAVING PROJECT.

THE MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF LANCASTER TO RENOVATE AND DEVELOP JAYCEE PARK. THE PROJECT INCLUDES RENOVATING RESTROOMS, SECURITY LIGHTING AND SHELTER #1. THE CITY OF LANCASTER ALSO PLANS TO REMOVE AND REPLACE AGING PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT AND INSTALL SAFETY SURFACING AROUND THE NEW PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT, INSTALL A NEW UNDERGROUND ELECTRICAL LINE AND CONNECT THE WALKWAYS BETWEEN THE PARKING LOT, RESTROOM, SHELTER #1 AND THE PLAYGROUND.AS A RESULT OF THIS PROJECT, JAYCEE PARK WILL BE THE ONLY PUBLIC PARK IN SCHUYLER COUNTY WITH ALL-INCLUSIVE OUTDOOR RESTROOMS AND PLAY EQUIPMENT. DUE TO THE LIMITED AVAILABILITY IN OUR RURAL COMMUNITY, LIGHTING AND RESTROOM IMPROVEMENTS WILL OPEN A WIDE VARIETY OF RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES. UPGRADING THE RESTROOMS AND INSTALLING NEW PLAYGROUND TO ADA STANDARDS AND ADDING GROUND COVERING TO OUR PLAYGROUND EQUIPMENT'S SAFE ZONES, AS WELL AS REGRADING AND OVERLAYING OUR CURRENT PATHS, THE PROJECT WILL RESULT IN ENHANCE AND SAFE ACCESSIBILITY FOR ALL VISITORS.

THE CITY OF LAS CRUCES PROPOSES TO RENOVATE AND IMPROVE APODACA PARK, LOCATED AT 801 E  MADRID AVE , LAS CRUCES, NM 88001  THE PROJECT WILL INCREASE THE AVAILABILITY OF CONTEMPORARY RECREATION ELEMENTS FOR NEARBY RESIDENTS, SPECIFICALLY FOR LOW INCOME AND DISADVANTAGED POPULATIONS THE PLANNED PHYSICAL IMPROVEMENTS TO THE PARK INCLUDE  1  AN AQUATIC PLAYGROUND,  2  AN ADA COMPLIANT RESTROOM,  3  GROUP PICNIC SHELTERS,  4  UPGRADED PLAYGROUND AMENITIES,  5  ADA COMPLIANCE MULTI USE TRAIL WITH EXERCISE STATIONS, AND  6  LANDSCAPING AND SUPPORT AMENITIES INCLUDING RECYCLE RECEPTACLES, DOG LITTER BAG DISPENSERS, STORMWATER HARVESTING RAIN GARDENS AND BIOSWALES THE PROJECT WILL SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE THE TYPES OF RECREATIONAL AND COMMUNITY USE OPPORTUNITIES AVAILABLE AT THE PARK AND WILL BENEFIT THE MORE THAN 170 EVENTS THAT OCCUR IN THE PARK ANNUALLY  REDEVELOPMENT WILL PROVIDE PARK AMENITIES OF A COMPARABLE CALIBER TO OTHER PARKS IN LAS CRUCES FOR THE PARK S ANNUAL 18,103 VISITORS BY REDEVELOPING THE PARK, THE CITY WILL  1  SPUR ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT,  2  IMPROVE RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOW INCOME FAMILIES, AND  3  INCREASE THE QUALITY OF LIFE WITHIN THE CITY, AS A WHOLE  THESE GOALS ARE SUPPORTED BY AN ASSESSMENT AND STRATEGY CALLED THE APODACA BLUEPRINT, AS WELL AS ENGAGEMENT MEETINGS WITH CITY YOUTH  THE ASSESSMENT AND ENGAGEMENT MEETINGS HIGHLIGHTED A NEED TO IMPROVE THE CONDITION OF THE AREA AND THE QUALITY OF LIFE WITHIN THE SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS AND IDENTIFIED THAT RESIDENTS WITHIN A 1 4 MILE OF THE PARK INCLUDE LOW INCOME FAMILIES AND RESIDENTS WHO HAVE LIMITED ACCESS TO OTHER RECREATIONAL AREAS WITHIN THE CITY

THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF WARD TO THE CITY OF WACONIA TO CONSTRUCT AN INCLUSIVE PLAYGROUND, RELOCATE AN EXISTING SHELTER, DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT A COMMUNITY GARDEN, EXPAND THE PARKING LOT, REDEVELOP TRAILS, IMPROVE STORM SEWER STRUCTURES, AND INSTALL LIGHTING AND ELECTRICAL AT WATERFORD PARK.THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A PLAYGROUND WITH PLAY SYSTEMS THAT HAVE ACCESSIBLE SURFACING WHERE CHILDREN OF ALL ABILITIES ARE ABLE TO PLAY. THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN AN INCREASE OF RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR WACONIA RESIDENTS AND VISITORS.

A CONCRETE SIDEWALK THAT RUNS FROM THE EDGE OF THE PARKING LOT TO THE SPLASH PAD AND BATHROOM FACILITY WILL PROVIDE EFFICIENT ACCESSIBILITY TO ALL VISITORS. THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF RICHMOND TO DEVELOP PICKLEBALL COURTS, WALKWAYS, AND SHADE STRUCTURES WITH BENCHES IN CENTENNIAL PARK.THE OUTCOME OF THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FACILITIES THAT MEET THE DIFFERING OUTDOOR RECREATION NEEDS FOR PEOPLE OF ALL ABILITIES AND BACKGROUND. THE IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF PARKS AND RECREATION WILL SUBGRANT LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF SALMON TO DEVELOP A 2,400 SQUARE FOOT INCLUSIVE AND ACCESSIBLE SPLASH PAD AT THE 149.56-ARCE CITY PARK. THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF PANAMA CITY IN INSTALL NEWFACILITIES AT HENTZ PARK. THE CITY WILL INSTALL A 15,360 LINEAR FOOT EXERCISE TRAIL WITH OUTDOOR EXERCISE EQUIPMENT, THREE PICNIC PAVILIONS WITH TWO TABLES AND TWO GRILLS EACH, TWO NEW PLAYGROUNDS - ONE FOR CHILDREN AGES 2-5 AND ANOTHER FOR AGES 5-12, A POND WITH A KAYAK LAUNCH, A PARKING LOT, TWO WATER FOUNTAINS, FOUR BENCHES, FOUR BIKE RACKS, FOUR TRASH RECEPTACLES, 10 SOLAR LIGHTS FOR PICNIC PAVILIONS, 75 LIGHTS/LIGHT POLES, 75 TREES, AND IRRIGATION. HENTZ PARK AND THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITY WAS DEVASTATED BY HURRICANE MICHAEL IN 2018. 60% OF HOMES WERE LOST DUE TO THE HURRICANE AND THE CITY LOST APPROXIMATELY 10,000 RESIDENTS. THE AREA REBUILT AND IMPROVED OVER THE LAST FEW YEARS BUT HENTZ PARK REMAINS IN NEED OF REPAIR. THE PARK ONCE HAD A LARGE TREE CANOPY BUT IT WAS DESTROYED, ALONG WITH MUCH OF THE RECREATIONAL FACILITIES, BY HURRICANE MICHAEL. RESIDENTS HAVE RETURNED TO THE AREA IN RECENT YEARS AND THE CITY'S POPULATION REBOUNDED WITH MANY FAMILIES MOVING TO THE COMMUNITY. THE HENTZ PARK NEIGHBORHOOD HAS 169 CHILDREN UNDER THE AGE OF FIVE, AN 8% INCREASE OF CHILDREN UNDER FIVE AND WITH A 7.5% INCREASE OF CHILDREN AGES 5-12. BY IMPROVING HENTZ PARK AND RESTORING IT TO A VIABLE RECREATIONAL FACILITY, CHILDREN AND FAMILIES WILL HAVE A NEIGHBORHOOD PARK TO ENJOY AND A FACILITY THAT WILL CONTINUE TO ATTRACT FAMILIES TO THE COMMUNITY, RESTORING THE AREA ECONOMICALLY AS WELL.

THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF NEW BRIGHTON TO REDEVELOP TWO EXISTING BALLFIELDS, ADD ONE MULTI-PURPOSE TURF FIELD, CONSOLIDATE TWO PARKING AREAS INTO ONE, IMPROVE TRAILS, AND ENHANCE THE DISC GOLF COURSE IN HANSEN PARK. HANSEN PARK IS A KEY COMMUNITY PARK IN NEW BRIGHTON. IMPROVING THE PARK'S AMENITIES WILL ALLOW THE PARK TO MEET THE CITY'S EXPANDING RECREATIONAL NEEDS. COMMUNITY INPUT HAS IDENTIFIED THE NEED FOR BOTH FLEXIBLE LAWN FIELDS AND QUALITY BALLFIELDS, SUITABLE FOR GAMES AND TOURNAMENTS. THE UNIQUE APPEAL OF THE DISC GOLF COURSE IS A KEY PART OF THE PARK'S IDENTITY. REDEVELOPMENT AND CONSOLIDATION OF THE PARKING LOTS AND DEGRADED BALLFIELDS ALONG WITH DISC GOLF ENHANCEMENTS AND A MULTIPURPOSE TURF FIELD WILL GREATLY IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF EXISTING PARK AMENITIES AS WELL AS SAFETY AND ACCESS TO AND WITHIN THE PARK. EXPANDING THE NUMBER OF RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES AVAILABLE WILL IMPROVE THE OVERALL EXPERIENCE FOR PARK USERS AND INCREASE FLEXIBILITY IN THE PARK FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE TRENDS IN RECREATION.

THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF INVER GROVE HEIGHTS TO CONSTRUCT AN OPEN-AIR PICNIC SHELTER, BENCH SHELTER COVERING STRUCTURES, RESTROOM/CHANGING ROOM BUILDING IN HERITAGE VILLAGE PARK. THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF PORT ST. LUCIE TO DEVELOP RECREATIONAL FACILITIES AT THE NEW ADVENTURE PARK.ADVENTURE PARK IS PRESENTLY UNDEVELOPED AND WILL BE LOCATED ON 39.57 ACRES OF LAND LOCATED ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE FLORIDA TURNPIKE. THE AREA HAS LESS UNDEVELOPED AREAS AND THE POPULATION EXPANSION HAS SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCED OPEN SPACE AND NATURAL AREAS AND ADVENTURE PARK WILL BE DEVELOPED IN A FORMER STORM DEBRIS STAGING AREA DUE TO THE LACK OF AVAILABLE UNDEVELOPED LAND. THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO OKEECHOBEE COUNTY TO MAKE RENOVATIONS AND INSTALLATION OF NEW FACILITIES AT KIWANIS PARK. OKEECHOBEE COUNTY IS A RURAL AREA IN CENTRAL FLORIDA WITH A DIVERSE COMMUNITY. IMPROVEMENTS AT KIWANIS PARK WILL INCREASE RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR A RURAL POPULACE THAT IS IN NEED OF IMPROVED PARK FACILITIES. THE INSTALLATION OF THE PUMP TRACK AND BOCCE BALL AREA WILL APPEAL TO A DIVERSE POPULATION INCREASINGLY IN NEED OF A VARIETY OF RECREATION FACILITIES THAT ARE ATTRACTIVE TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY.

THE NORTH CAROLINA, DIVISION OF PARKS AND RECREATION IS THE RECIPIENT OF THE LWCF AWARD FOR ROOSEVELT STATE PARK RENOVATIONS. THE PROJECT WILL RENOVATE, REPAIR, AND IMPROVE THE PARK'S VISITOR'S CENTER, 15 CABINS, BATHHOUSE, WALKWAYS AND PROVIDE LANDSCAPING AND EROSION CONTROL UPGRADES. UPGRADES HAVE NOT BEEN COMPLETED IN APPROXIMATELY 40 YEARS AT THE PARK AND MUCH NEEDED WORKS IS REQUIRED TO REPAIR OR REPLACE ROTTEN EXTERIOR AND INTERIOR SIDING, FLOORS, CEILING, ROOF, SOFFIT, FASCIA ECT. PAITING, REPLACEMENT OF CARPET WITH DURABLE VINYL PLANK TILE FLOORING AND REPLACEMENT OF BATHROOM HOWERS, ABATORY AND CABINETRY. ALSO TO BE INSTALLED OUTSIDE OF THE CABINS ARE OUTDOOR GRILLS AND FIRE PITS.THE PARK REHABILITATION WILL IMPROVE THE PUBLIC'S EXPERIENCE WITHIN THE PARK BY RE-ESTABLISHING STRUCTURAL INTEGRITY AND FUNCTION. BECAUSE THIS IS A STATE PARK, THIS WILL NOT ONLY PROVIDE A BETTER OUTDOOR EXPERIENCE FOR THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AND STATE BUT ANYONE WHO VISITS THE PARK FROM OUT OF STATE. THE REHABILITATION WILL ALSO INCREASE THE LIFE OF THE STRUCTURES THAT WILL BE REHABILITATED.

21-01605 ABSTRACT SUMMARYTHE KENTUCKY DEPARTMENT FOR LOCAL GOVERNMENT OFFICE OF FEDERAL GRANTS WILL SUBGRANT THE ORLP AWARD TO THE CITY OF BOWLING GREEN, KY FOR REDEVELOPMENT OF RIVERFRONT PARK. THE DEVELOPMENTS WILL IMPROVE AND ENHANCE ACCESS TO THE BARREN RIVER WITH THE INSTALLATION OF A BOAT RAMP AND FISHING ACCESS FACILITIES AT RIVERFRONT PARK WEST. THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE RIVERBANK STABILIZATION, RIPARIAN ZONE RESTORATION, A BOAT ACCESS RAMP, A DRIVEWAY AND PARKING LOT, RESTROOMS, FISHING PLATFORMS, PICNIC/SHADE PAVILIONS, FISHING HABITAT IMPROVEMENTS, SIDEWALKS, SIGNAGE, TRASH RECEPTACLES, SEATING, LANDSCAPING, AND A GRAVEL TRAIL TO CONNECT TO EXISTING TRAILS TO THE GREENWAY BENEATH THE RIVER STREET BRIDGE. THE OUTCOME WILL RESULT IN IMPROVED SAFETY AND ACCESS TO RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES ALONG THE RIVER.

THE WASHINGTON RECREATION AND CONSERVATION OFFICE WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF GIG HARBOR TO EXPAND GIG HARBOR SPORTS COMPLEX WITH PICKLEBALL COURTS, BOCCE BALL COURTS, PLAYGROUND AREA, AN EVENT LAWN, A SHELTERED PERFORMANCE STAGE, TWO COVERED PICNIC AREAS, AND ASSOCIATED PARKING  THE CITY OF GIG HARBOR WILL USE THIS GRANT TO DEVELOP PHASE 1B THE PICKLE BO SPOT, APPROXIMATELY 3 4 ACRES, OF THE GIG HARBOR SPORTS COMPLEX  THIS PROJECT SITE IS LOCATED ON AN UNDEVELOPED PARCEL NORTH OF THE YMCA PARKING LOT ON HARBOR HILL DRIVE NEW FACILITIES INCLUDE A NEW PLAYGROUND WITH SYNTHETIC TURF FOR TOT AND SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN NEW PICKLEBALL AND BOCCE BALL COURTS A SHELTERED STAGE AREA FOR COMMUNITY PERFORMANCES AND EVENTS A FLEXIBLE OPEN EVENT LAWN SPACE FOR PICNICKING, GATHERING, SOCIALIZING, AND RELAXING ANDALL FACILITIES WILL BE ADA ACCESSIBLE SITE IMPROVEMENTS INCLUDE LAND CLEARINGGRADINGLANDSCAPINGBUILDING CONSTRUCTIONPLAYGROUND CONSTRUCTIONSPORT COURT CONSTRUCTIONPARKING LOT CONSTRUCTIONTHE GIG HARBOR SPORTS COMPLEX WILL SERVE NEARLY 50,000 IN THE SURROUNDING 5 MILE RADIUS AND PROVIDE ATHLETIC RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES AND PASSIVE RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES

THE CITY OF EMMETT, IDAHO WILL ENHANCE EMMETT CITY PARK BY INSTALLING A 3,000SF SPLASH PAD, PRE-CAST RESTROOM, AND LANDSCAPING. NEW WALKWAYS WILL CONNECT THE AMENITIES TO EACH OTHER AND TO AN EXISTING PARKING AREA. THE NEW FACILITIES REPLACE A PREVIOUSLY  DEMOLISHED SWIMMING POOL. THE NEW AMENITIES WILL BE ACCESSIBLE, MAKING THE PARK MORE INCLUSIVE FOR EMMET RESIDENTS.

THE ARIZONA STATE PARKS AND TRAILS WILL UTILIZE THE LWCF GRANT TO REPLACE AN AGING WATER TOWER WITH A TWO-TANK DRINKING WATER AND FIRE SUPPRESSION WATER SYSTEM, REPLACE A MAINTENANCE BUILDING, AND TO DEVELOP AN INCLUSIVE AND ACCESSIBLE AMPHITHEATER WITH PATHWAY AT RED ROCK STATE PARK. PARK IMPROVEMENTS WILL CONSERVE WATER AND INCREASE ACCESSIBILITY OF ITS OUTDOOR RECREATION FACILITIES AND SUPPORT FACILITIES.

THE CITY OF SHOW LOW, THROUGH ARIZONA STATE PARKS AND TRIALS, WILL UTILIZE A LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND GRANT TO FURTHER DEVELOP FRONTIER PARK. THIS DEVELOPMENT WILL INCLUDE CONSTRUCTION OF A SPLASH PAD, INCLUSIVE PLAYGROUND, PARKING LOT WITH 9 HANDICAP SPACES AND RELATED INFRASTRUCTURE INCLUDING A MECHANICAL BUILDING. THE IMPROVEMENTS WILL AID IN MEETING THE RECREATIONAL NEEDS OF THE CITY OF SHOW LOW WITH A FOCUS ON CHILDREN WITH DISABILITIES.

THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF PARKS AND RECREATION WILL SUBGRANT THE LWCF AWARD TO THE CITY OF MOORPARK, TO RENOVATE AND EXPAND TIERRA REJADA PARK.  THE PROJECT WILL REPLACE THE ANTIQUATED PLAYGROUND WITH A NEW ACCESSIBLE AND INCLUSIVE PLAYGROUND WITH AGE-SPECIFIC PLAY STRUCTURES AS WELL AS INNOVATIVE FEATURES DESIGNED FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH MOBILITY, DEVELOPMENTAL, AND SIGHT IMPAIRMENTS, SUCH AS A SENSORY PLAY WALL AND FRIENDSHIP SWING.  OTHER IMPROVEMENTS INCLUDE NEW SURFACING, ADDITIONAL PICNIC AREAS, SHADE STRUCTURES, PARKING LOT EXPANSION, AND LANDSCAPING.  THE OUTCOME OF THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE PLAY AND RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES FOR CHILDREN OF ALL AGES AND ABILITIES WITHIN THE CITY OF MOORPARK AND EASTERN VENTURA COUNTY.  THE NEAREST OPPORTUNITY SIMILAR TO THIS IS 20 MILES AWAY, AND THE COMMUNITY HAS DESIRED A PARK AMENITY LIKE THIS FOR MANY YEARS.
